of enfeeblement","spelllevel":"1","type":"divine","frequency":"x/day"}]","immunities":"death effects, disease","perception":"28","armor_class":"38","description":"Bounty hunters and investigators, morrignas seek out creatures that thwart death or interfere with the natural flow of souls. Morrignas dress in flowing spider silk and wear masks reminiscent of webs, as they consider patient and watchful spiders to be their spiritual kin.

Psychopomps are guardians and shepherds of the dead native to the Boneyard, the vast plane of graves where mortal souls are judged and sent on to their eternal rewards or damnations. Psychopomps ensure that the dead come to terms with their transition from mortality and are properly sorted into the appropriate afterlife. They also protect souls from being preyed upon by supernatural predators. Nearly all psychopomps wear masks, especially when they’re likely to be interacting with mortals, although the types of masks they wear are as varied as the psychopomps themselves. The courts of the Boneyard preside in Requian, a somber yet melodic language spoken slowly with various tonal shifts.

Psychopomp Divinities
The most powerful of the psychopomps are unique demigods known collectively as “ushers,” each of whom has its own cult.
These psychopomp divinities include Atropos, the Last Sister; Barzahk, the Passage; Ceyanan, the Shepherd; Dammar, the Denied; Imot, the Symbol of Doom; Mother Vulture, the Flesheater; Mrtyu, Death’s Consort; Narakas, the Cleansing Sentence; the Pale Horse; Phlegyas, Consoler of Atheists; Saloc, Minder of Immortals; Teshallas, the Primordial Poison; and
Vale, the Court of the Ancestors.


Other Psychopomps
Nosois and morrignas are far from the only of their kind. Many others, like the skeletal vanths or the draconic yamarajes, also aid in the stewardship of the dead.

attribs.name: languages
attribs.current: Abyssal, Celestial, Infernal, Necril, Requian, Speak with Animals, Tongues

attribs.name: saving_throws_notes
attribs.current: +1 Status to All Saves vs. Magic

attribs.name: repeating_interaction-abilities_-NJR9Kib738fA3iKz2ZM_description
attribs.current: A psychopomp senses the vital essence of living and undead creatures within the listed range.

attribs.name: repeating_free-actions-reactions_-NJR9Kib738fA3iKz2ZN_trigger
attribs.current: A creature within reach of the morrigna’s web wrappings uses an action to Strike or attempt a skill check.

attribs.name: repeating_free-actions-reactions_-NJR9Kib738fA3iKz2ZN_description
attribs.current: Effect: The morrigna makes a web wrappings Strike against the triggering creature. If the strike is a critical hit, the triggering action is disrupted.

attribs.name: repeating_actions-activities_-NJR9Kib738fA3iKz2ZQ_description
attribs.current:
A morrigna can take the appearance of any Small or Medium animal or humanoid. This doesn’t change their Speed or their attack and damage modifiers with their Strikes, but it might change the damage type their Strikes deal. Unless they choose to manifest their web wrappings in their new form, they cannot make web wrappings Strikes. 
The monster changes its shape indefinitely. It can use this action again to return to its natural shape or adopt a new shape. Unless otherwise noted, a monster cannot use Change Shape to appear as a specific individual. Using Change Shape counts as creating a disguise for the Impersonate use of Deception. The monster’s transformation automatically defeats Perception DCs to determine whether the creature is a member of the ancestry or creature type into which it transformed, and it gains a +4 status bonus to its Deception DC to prevent others from seeing through its disguise. Change Shape abilities specify what shapes the monster can adopt. The monster doesn’t gain any special abilities of the new shape, only its physical form. For example, in each shape, it replaces its normal Speeds and Strikes, and might potentially change its senses or size. Any changes are listed in its stat block.

attribs.name: repeating_actions-activities_-NJR9Kib738fA3iKz2ZR_description
attribs.current: The morrigna summons a giant tarantula or spider swarm. These spiders have the summoned trait and remain for 10 minutes or until reduced to 0 Hit Points, whichever comes first. The morrigna does not need to Sustain the Spell to direct these summoned creatures, and the morrigna can have any number of summoned spiders in existence at once. The morrigna can see through the eyes of any of their summoned spiders at any time.

attribs.name: repeating_actions-activities_-NJR9Kib738fA3iKz2ZS_description
attribs.current: A morrigna's Strikes affect incorporeal creatures as though etched with a ghost touch property rune and deal [[4d6]] (4d6) negative damage to living creatures or [[4d6]] (4d6) positive damage to undead.

attribs.name: repeating_actions-activities_-NJR9Kib738fA3iKz2ZT_description
attribs.current: DC 35, attack +30; 6th (4 slots) field of life, heal, spirit blast; 5th (4 slots) death ward, dispel magic, sending; 4th (4 slots) freedom of movement, read omens, spell immunity; 3rd (4 slots) blindness, crisis of faith, dream message; 2nd (4 slots) calm emotions, see invisibility, silence; 1st (4 slots) bane, bless, ray of enfeeblement; Cantrips (8th) chill touch, detect magic, disrupt undead, read aura, stabilize

attribs.name: repeating_actions-activities_-NJR9Kib738fA3iKz2ZU_description
attribs.current: DC 37; 4th talking corpse; Constant (5th) tongues, (2nd) speak with animals, spider climb

attribs.name: repeating_spellinnate_-NJR9KichOvN1g2cBC1W_description
attribs.current: A morrigna grants the target corpse a semblance of life, which it uses to speak the answers to three questions posed to it. This spell calls on the physical body's latent memories rather than summoning back the deceased's spirit, so the corpse must be mostly intact for the spell to function. The more damage the corpse has taken, the more inaccurate or patchwork its answers are, and it must have a throat and mouth to speak at all. If anyone has previously cast this spell on the corpse in the last week, the spell automatically fails. The corpse can attempt a Will save to resist answering the questions using the statistics of the original creature at its time of death, with the following effects.

attribs.name: repeating_spellinnate_-NJR9KichOvN1g2cBC1X_description
attribs.current: The target can understand all words regardless of language and also speak the languages of other creatures. When in a mixed group of creatures, each time the target speaks, it can choose a creature and speak in a language that creature understands, even if the target doesn't know what language that is.

attribs.name: repeating_spellinnate_-NJR9KichOvN1g2cBC1Y_description
attribs.current: A morrigna can ask questions of, receive answers from, and use the Diplomacy skill with animals. The spell doesn't make them more friendly than normal. Cunning animals are likely to be terse and evasive, while less intelligent ones often make inane comments.

attribs.name: repeating_spellinnate_-NJR9KichOvN1g2cBC1Z_description
attribs.current: Tiny clinging hairs sprout across the creature's hands and feet, offering purchase on nearly any surface. The target gains a climb Speed equal to its Speed.

attribs.name: repeating_cantrip_-NJR9KichOvN1g2cBC1Z_description
attribs.current:
Siphoning negative energy into itself, a morrigna's hand radiates a pale darkness. The morrigna's touch weakens the living and disorients undead, possibly even causing them to flee. The effect depends on whether the target is living or undead.
• Living Creature The spell deals negative damage equal to 1d4 plus the morrigna's wisdom modifier. The target attempts a basic Fortitude save, but is also enfeebled 1 for 1 round on a critical failure.
• Undead Creature The target is flat-footed for 1 round on a failed Fortitude save. On a critical failure, the target is also fleeing for 1 round unless it succeeds at a Will save.

attribs.name: repeating_cantrip_-NJR9KichOvN1g2cBC1a_description
attribs.current:
A morrigna sends out a pulse that registers the presence of magic. The morrigna receives no information beyond the presence or absence of magic. The morrigna can choose to ignore magic it's fully aware of, such as the magic items and ongoing spells of it and its allies.
The morrigna detects illusion magic only if that magic's effect has a lower level than the level of its detect magic spell. However, items that have an illusion aura but aren't deceptive in appearance (such as an invisibility potion) typically are detected normally.

attribs.name: repeating_cantrip_-NJR9KichOvN1g2cBC1b_description
attribs.current: A morrigna lances the target with energy. The morrigna deals 1d6 positive damage plus its wisdom modifier. The target must attempt a basic Fortitude save. If the creature critically fails the save, it is also enfeebled 1 for 1 round.

attribs.name: repeating_cantrip_-NJR9KichOvN1g2cBC1c_description
attribs.current:
A morrigna focuses on the target object, opening its mind to perceive magical auras. When the casting is complete, the morrigna knows whether that item is magical, and if it is, it learns the school of magic.
If the object is illusory, the morrigna detects this only if the effect's level is lower than the level of its read aura spell.

attribs.name: repeating_cantrip_-NJR9KichOvN1g2cBC1d_description
attribs.current: Positive energy shuts death's door. The target loses the dying condition, though it remains unconscious at 0 Hit Points.

attribs.name: repeating_normalspells_-NJR9KichOvN1g2cBC1e_description
attribs.current: A field of positive energy fills the area, exuding warmth and rejuvenating those within. Each living creature that starts its turn in the area regains 1d8 Hit Points, and any undead creature that starts its turn in the area takes 1d8 positive damage.

attribs.name: repeating_normalspells_-NJR9KichOvN1g2cBC1f_description
attribs.current:
A morrigna channels positive energy to heal the living or damage the undead. If the target is a willing living creature, the morrigna restores 1d8 Hit Points. If the target is undead, the morrigna deals that amount of positive damage to it, and it gets a basic Fortitude save. The number of actions the morrigna spends when Casting this Spell determines its targets, range, area, and other parameters.
[one-action] (somatic) The spell has a range of touch.
[two-actions] (somatic, verbal) The spell has a range of 30 feet. If the morrigna's healing a living creature, increase the Hit Points restored by 8.
[three-actions] (material, somatic, verbal) The morrigna disperses positive energy in a 30-foot emanation. This targets all living and undead creatures in the burst.

attribs.name: repeating_normalspells_-NJR9KichOvN1g2cBC1g_description
attribs.current: A morrigna concentrates ethereal energy and attack a creature's spirit, dealing 16d6 force damage. Because spirit blast affects the creature's spirit, it can damage a target projecting its consciousness (such as via project image) or possessing another creature even if the target's body is elsewhere. The possessed creature isn't harmed by the blast. The blast doesn't harm creatures that have no spirit, such as constructs.

attribs.name: repeating_normalspells_-NJR9KichOvN1g2cBC1h_description
attribs.current: A morrigna shields a creature from the ravages of negative energy. It receives a +4 status bonus to saves against death and negative effects, gains negative resistance 10, and suppresses the effects of the doomed condition.

attribs.name: repeating_normalspells_-NJR9KichOvN1g2cBC1i_description
attribs.current: A morrigna unravels the magic behind a spell or effect. Attempt a counteract check against the target. Counteracting a Magic Item causes it to become mundane for 10 minutes. This doesn't change the item's non-magical properties. If the target is an artifact or similar item, the morrigna automatically fails.

attribs.name: repeating_normalspells_-NJR9KichOvN1g2cBC1j_description
attribs.current: A morrigna sends the creature a mental message of 25 words or fewer, and it can respond immediately with its own message of 25 words or fewer.

attribs.name: repeating_normalspells_-NJR9KichOvN1g2cBC1k_description
attribs.current: A morrigna repels effects that would hinder a creature or slow its movement. While under this spell's effect, the target ignores effects that would give them a circumstance penalty to Speed. When they attempt to Escape an effect that has them immobilized, grabbed, or restrained, they automatically succeed unless the effect is magical and of a higher level than the freedom of movement spell.

attribs.name: repeating_normalspells_-NJR9KichOvN1g2cBC1l_description
attribs.current: A morrigna peeks into the future. Choose a particular goal or activity the morrigna plans to engage in within 1 week, or an event it expect mights happen within 1 week. The morrigna learns a cryptic clue or piece of advice that could help with the chosen event, often in the form of a rhyme or omen.

attribs.name: repeating_normalspells_-NJR9KichOvN1g2cBC1m_description
attribs.current: A morrigna wards a creature against the effects of a single spell. Choose a spell and name it aloud as part of the verbal component. Spell immunity attempts to counteract that spell whenever spell immunity's target is the target of the named spell or in that spell's area. Successfully counteracting a spell that targets an area or multiple targets with spell immunity negates the effects only for the target affected by spell immunity.

attribs.name: repeating_normalspells_-NJR9KichOvN1g2cBC1n_description
attribs.current: A morrigna blinds the target. The effect is determined by the target 's Fortitude save. The target then becomes temporarily immune for 1 minute.

attribs.name: repeating_normalspells_-NJR9KichOvN1g2cBC1o_description
attribs.current:
A morrigna assaults the target's faith, riddling the creature with doubt and mental turmoil that deal 6d6 mental damage, or 6d8 mental damage if it can cast divine spells. The effects are determined by its Will save.
To many deities, casting this spell on a follower of the morrigna's own deity without significant cause is anathema.

attribs.name: repeating_normalspells_-NJR9KichOvN1g2cBC1p_description
attribs.current: A morrigna sends a message to its target's dream. The message is one-way, up to 1 minute of speech (roughly 150 words). If the target is asleep, they receive the message instantly. If not, they receive it the next time they sleep. As soon as they receive it, the spell ends, and the morrigna knows the message was sent.

attribs.name: repeating_normalspells_-NJR9KichOvN1g2cBC1q_description
attribs.current: A morrigna forcibly calms creatures in the area, soothing them into a nonviolent state; each creature must attempt a Will save.

attribs.name: repeating_normalspells_-NJR9KichOvN1g2cBC1r_description
attribs.current: A morrigna can see invisible creatures and objects. They appear to the morrigna as translucent shapes, and they are concealed to it.

attribs.name: repeating_normalspells_-NJR9KichOvN1g2cBC1s_description
attribs.current: The target makes no sound, preventing creatures from noticing it using hearing or other senses alone. The target can't use sonic attacks, nor can it use actions with the auditory trait. This prevents it from casting spells that include verbal components.

attribs.name: repeating_normalspells_-NJR9KichOvN1g2cBC1t_description
attribs.current: A morrigna fills the minds of its enemies with doubt. Targets that fail their Will saves take a –1 status penalty to attack rolls as long as they are in the area. Once per turn, starting the turn after the morrigna casts bane, it can use a single action, which has the concentrate trait, to increase the emanation’s radius by 5 feet and force enemies in the area that weren’t yet affected to attempt another saving throw. Bane can counteract bless.

attribs.name: repeating_normalspells_-NJR9KichOvN1g2cBC1u_description
attribs.current: Blessings from beyond help a morrigna's companions strike true. The morrigna and its allies in the area gain a +1 status bonus to attack rolls. Once per turn, starting the turn after the morrigna casts bless, it can use a single action, which has the concentrate trait, to increase the emanation's radius by 5 feet. Bless can counteract bane.

attribs.name: repeating_normalspells_-NJR9KichOvN1g2cBC1v_description
attribs.current: A ray with the power to sap a foe's strength flashes from a morrigna's hand. Attempt a ranged spell attack against the target. If the morrigna succeeds, that creature attempts a Fortitude save in order to determine the spell's effect. If the morrigna critically succeeds on its attack roll, use the outcome for one degree of success worse than the result of its save.

attribs.name: repeating_spellinnate_-NJR9KichOvN1g2cBC1W_save_failure
attribs.current: The target must answer truthfully, but its answers can be brief, cryptic, and repetitive. It can still mislead the morrigna or attempt to stall so that the spell's duration runs out before it can ask all its questions.

attribs.name: repeating_spellinnate_-NJR9KichOvN1g2cBC1W_save_success
attribs.current: The target can provide false information or refuse to answer the morrigna's questions.

attribs.name: repeating_spellinnate_-NJR9KichOvN1g2cBC1W_save_critical_failure
attribs.current: As failure, but the target's answers are more direct and less repetitive, though still cryptic. It takes a –2 status penalty to Deception checks to deceive or mislead the morrigna.

attribs.name: repeating_spellinnate_-NJR9KichOvN1g2cBC1W_save_critical_success
attribs.current: The target can lie or refuse to answer the morrigna's questions, and the target's spirit haunts it for 24 hours, bothering it and causing it to be unable to gain any rest for that time.

attribs.name: repeating_spellinnate_-NJR9KichOvN1g2cBC1Z_heightened
attribs.current: Heightened (5th) The duration increases to 1 hour.

attribs.name: repeating_cantrip_-NJR9KichOvN1g2cBC1Z_heightened
attribs.current: Heightened (+1) The negative damage to living creatures increases by 1d4.

attribs.name: repeating_cantrip_-NJR9KichOvN1g2cBC1a_heightened
attribs.current:
Heightened (3rd) A morrigna learns the school of magic for the highest-level effect within range that the spell detects. If multiple effects are equally strong, the GM determines which the morrigna learns.
Heightened (4th) As 3rd level, but a morrigna also pinpoints the source of the highest-level magic. Like for an imprecise sense, the morrigna doesn't learn the exact location, but can narrow down the source to within a 5-foot cube (or the nearest if larger than that).

attribs.name: repeating_cantrip_-NJR9KichOvN1g2cBC1b_save_critical_failure
attribs.current: If the creature critically fails the save, it is also enfeebled 1 for 1 round.

attribs.name: repeating_cantrip_-NJR9KichOvN1g2cBC1c_heightened
attribs.current:
Heightened (3rd) A morrigna can target up to 10 objects.
Heightened (6th) A morrigna can target any number of objects.

attribs.name: repeating_normalspells_-NJR9KichOvN1g2cBC1f_target
attribs.current: 1 Willing Living Creature or 1 Undead Creature

attribs.name: repeating_normalspells_-NJR9KichOvN1g2cBC1f_heightened
attribs.current: Heightened (+1) The amount of healing or damage increases by 1d8, and the extra healing for the 2-action version increases by 8.

attribs.name: repeating_normalspells_-NJR9KichOvN1g2cBC1i_target
attribs.current: 1 Spell Effect or Unattended Magic Item

attribs.name: repeating_normalspells_-NJR9KichOvN1g2cBC1j_target
attribs.current: 1 Creature with Whom the Morrigna is Familiar

attribs.name: repeating_normalspells_-NJR9KichOvN1g2cBC1n_save_failure
attribs.current: The target is blinded for 1 minute.

attribs.name: repeating_normalspells_-NJR9KichOvN1g2cBC1n_save_success
attribs.current: The target is blinded until its next turn begins.

attribs.name: repeating_normalspells_-NJR9KichOvN1g2cBC1o_heightened
attribs.current: Heightened (+1) The damage increases by 2d6 (or by 2d8 if the target is a divine spellcaster.)

attribs.name: repeating_normalspells_-NJR9KichOvN1g2cBC1o_save_failure
attribs.current: The target takes full damage; if the target can cast divine spells, it's stupefied 1 for 1 round.

attribs.name: repeating_normalspells_-NJR9KichOvN1g2cBC1o_damage_additional
attribs.current: or [[6d8]] Mental Damage If It Can Cast Divine Spells

attribs.name: repeating_normalspells_-NJR9KichOvN1g2cBC1o_save_critical_failure
attribs.current: The target takes double damage, is stupefied 1 for 1 round, and can't cast divine spells for 1 round.

attribs.name: repeating_normalspells_-NJR9KichOvN1g2cBC1p_target
attribs.current: 1 Creature the Morrigna Knows by Name and Have Met in Person

attribs.name: repeating_normalspells_-NJR9KichOvN1g2cBC1p_heightened
attribs.current: Heightened (4th) A morrigna can target up to 10 creatures it knows by name and have met in person. The morrigna must send the same message to all of them; the spell ends for each creature individually.

attribs.name: repeating_normalspells_-NJR9KichOvN1g2cBC1q_save_failure
attribs.current: Any emotion effects that would affect the creature are suppressed and the creature can't use hostile actions. If the target is subject to hostility from any other creature, it ceases to be affected by calm emotions.

attribs.name: repeating_normalspells_-NJR9KichOvN1g2cBC1q_save_success
attribs.current: Calming urges impose a -1 status penalty to the creature's attack rolls.

attribs.name: repeating_normalspells_-NJR9KichOvN1g2cBC1q_save_critical_failure
attribs.current: As failure, but hostility doesn't end the effect.

attribs.name: repeating_normalspells_-NJR9KichOvN1g2cBC1r_heightened
attribs.current: Heightened (5th) The spell has a duration of 8 hours.

attribs.name: repeating_normalspells_-NJR9KichOvN1g2cBC1s_heightened
attribs.current: Heightened (4th) The spell effect emanates from the touched creature, silencing all sound in or passing through a 10-foot radius and preventing any auditory and sonic effects in the affected area. While within the radius, creatures are subject to the same effects as the target. Depending upon the position of the effect, a creature might notice the lack of sound reaching it (blocking off the noise coming from a party, for example).

attribs.name: repeating_normalspells_-NJR9KichOvN1g2cBC1e_heightened
attribs.current:
Heightened (8th) The healing and damage increase to 1d10.
Heightened (9th) The healing and damage increase to 1d12.

attribs.name: repeating_normalspells_-NKXl67VU43s0NjuDzFy_cast_detail_information
attribs.current: Rare Candles and Incense Worth a Total Value of 50 gp

attribs.name: repeating_normalspells_-NKXl67VU43s0NjuDzFy_description
attribs.current:
Secondary Casters 1
Primary Check Occultism (expert) or Religion (expert); Secondary Checks Occultism or Religion (whichever isn’t used for the primary check)

A morrigna tears the veil to the afterlife and call a spirit from its final resting place. The morrigna must call the spirit by name, and it must provide a connection to the spirit, such as a possession, a garment, or a piece of its corpse. A spirit unwilling to heed the morrigna's call can attempt a Will save to avoid it; on a critical success, a trickster spirit Impersonates the spirit the morrigna meant to call. The DC of the Will save is 2 lower if the morrigna hasn’t met the spirit in life. Either way, the spirit appears as a wispy form of the creature the morrigna meant to call. Each minute of the duration, the morrigna can ask the spirit a question. It can answer how it pleases or even refuse to answer. If the spirit isn’t in the afterlife (such as if it’s an undead), all results other than critical failures use the failure effect.

attribs.name: repeating_normalspells_-NKXl67VU43s0NjuDzFy_save_critical_success

{"size":"Medium","Token":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/files.d20.io/images/206470496/PMJsm13y6leQjuftmcngIg/original.png","level":"9","speed":"30","senses":"darkvision, true seeing","traits":"Fiend, Sahkil","stealth":"18","Category":"Monsters","npc_type":"Creature","spell_dc":"30","Expansion":"9361","alignment":"NE","data-List":"false","deception":"21","diplomacy":"21","languages":"Abyssal, Celestial, Infernal, Requian; telepathy 100 feet, tongues","acrobatics":"18","immunities":"fear, poison","perception":"18","weaknesses":"good 5","armor_class":"26","description":"Sahkil
Ages ago, when this cycle of the multiverse was still adolescent, a cabal of psychopomps who already felt bored and restrained in their role of ushering souls to their ultimate resting place rebelled against their station. It was this corruption of the cycle of souls that spawned the first sahkils. 
Ambivalent to the prescribed order of the multiverse and spiteful of mortals, sahkils delight in spreading fear and unease to all beings, clogging up the metaphysical cycle with anxiety-ridden mortals too scared to achieve their potential. These fiends have drastically changed from their dedicated psychopomp predecessors. They are creatures of spite and torment, fear and disgust. They exploit the most common and rare fears for their own perverse satisfaction, and they want nothing more than to frighten mortals and make them question their reason for existence.
Most sahkils lurk on the Ethereal Plane, but they frequently invade the Material Plane to torment mortals and spread terror. They use their innate ability to slip between the veils of the Ethereal and Material effortlessly, often stalking their targets for days or weeks before enacting their devious plots.
Check with Friends
Sahkils are creatures of fear and terror. Roleplaying encounters with sahkils could be troubling to some players, and delving deep into the kinds of traumas sahkils relish in unleashing could have unintentional effects on your game and your friends. Before introducing sahkils into your game, talk with your players to learn about any particular phobias or limits to determine what content you bring to the table, and consider that on your own behalf as well. Some specific elements to be aware of are the ximtal’s abilities around sensory deprivation and social isolation, as well as the kimenhul’s trauma-related abilities and themes. 
Feeding on Fear
Sahkils are immortal planar beings and don’t require material sustenance, but they do seem to gain some semblance of nourishment from the fear they spread. Whether this is psychological or biological remains to be seen, but their obsession with frightening other creatures is clear. Sahkils recognize that they are already feared, so it may be that they are simply fulfilling what they believe is their ultimate purpose.
War Against Hope
Sahkils and couatls are eternal enemies. The creatures each vie for the hearts of mortals, but from different sides of a single ideological coin. Sahkils wish to instill only fear into mortal hearts, trying to reduce them into useless piles of flesh who accomplish little. Couatls work to light the fires of hope, inspiring mortals to rise up and achieve their potential.
Planar Relations
Sahkils collaborate with divs to corrupt and corrode mortals. Velstracs, who appreciate sahkils’ depredations, sometimes work with these fiends to enact terrible horror on their victims. Nihilistic and disaffected, daemons tolerate sahkils but tend to view them as useless provocateurs.
Sahkil Tormentors
The most powerful among sahkils are the sahkil tormentors. These deific beings rule over sahkils as a whole, and many personally direct the actions of their lesser cousins. Others fall into ambivalent routines, focusing more on their own personal acts of torment rather than launching widespread, ambitious depredations upon unsuspecting mortals.
Xibalba
Within the ghostly realm of the Ethereal Plane, sahkils inhabit a terrifying realm known as Xibalba. The Land of Dread is a realm of nightmares made manifest. At the center of this demiplane is a tiered pyramid known as the Black Pyramid, where the sahkil tormentors rule their brethren and sow fear through the mortal realm.
Pakalchi
Pakalchis strive to intensify their preys’ inherent insecurity over personal and emotional bonds, playing on the threat of those relationships falling into ruin. These sahkils are among the most manipulative of their kind, pulling strings both literal and figurative on their victims over stretched-out periods of time, exhilarating in the despair and fear for attribs.current: Miss Whisper is considered 2 lower for the purpose of being conjured by the planar binding ritual (and potentially other rituals, at the GM’s discretion), but she is always free to attack or leave instead of negotiate unless the primary caster’s check is a critical success.

attribs.name: repeating_free-actions-reactions_-NJR9o9jZzIK1eI4GTo-_trigger
attribs.current: A creature moves adjacent to Miss Whisper;

attribs.name: repeating_free-actions-reactions_-NJR9o9jZzIK1eI4GTo-_description
attribs.current: Effect: Writhing, pitch-black vines wrap around the creature. The creature takes [[1d6]] (1d6) slashing damage and takes a –15-foot circumstance penalty to its Speeds until the end of its next turn.

attribs.name: repeating_ranged-strikes_-NJR9o9jZzIK1eI4GTo2_weapon_strike_damage_additional

attribs.name: repeating_actions-activities_-NJR9o9jZzIK1eI4GTo3_description

attribs.name: repeating_actions-activities_-NJR9o9jZzIK1eI4GTo4_description
attribs.current: Miss Whisper moves from the Material Plane to the Ethereal Plane or vice-versa, with the effects of ethereal jaunt except that the effect has an unlimited duration and can be Dismissed.

attribs.name: repeating_actions-activities_-NJR9o9jZzIK1eI4GTo5_description
attribs.current: DC 30; 7th mask of terror (self only); 6th dominate; 5th charm, calm emotions, suggestion (at will); Cantrips (5th) detect magic; Constant (6th) tongues, true seeing

attribs.name: repeating_spellinnate_-NJR9o9jZzIK1eI4GTo6_description
attribs.current:
self only
Miss Whisper appears to be a gruesome and terrifying creature. The effect is unique to each observer, so a human viewing the target might see a demon with bloody fangs, but a demon observing the target might see a glowing angelic visage.
When any creature attempts a hostile action against Miss Whisper, the creature must attempt a Will save. It is then temporarily immune until the end of its next turn.

attribs.name: repeating_spellinnate_-NJR9o9jZzIK1eI4GTo7_description
attribs.current: Miss Whisper takes command of the target, forcing it to obey her orders. If Miss Whisper issues an obviously self-destructive order, the target doesn't act until she issues a new order. The effect depends on its Will save.

attribs.name: repeating_spellinnate_-NJR9o9jZzIK1eI4GTo8_description
attribs.current:
To the target, Miss Whisper's words are honey and her visage seems bathed in a dreamy haze. It must attempt a Will save, with a +4 circumstance bonus if Miss Whisper or her allies recently threatened it or used hostile actions against it. 
Miss Whisper can Dismiss the spell. If Miss Whisper uses hostile actions against the target, the spell ends. When the spell ends, the target doesn 't necessarily realize it was charmed unless its friendship with Miss Whisper or the actions she convinced it to take clash with its expectations, meaning she could potentially convince the target to continue being her friend via mundane means.

attribs.name: repeating_spellinnate_-NJR9o9jZzIK1eI4GTo9_description
attribs.current: Miss Whisper forcibly calms creatures in the area, soothing them into a nonviolent state; each creature must attempt a Will save.

attribs.name: repeating_spellinnate_-NJR9o9jZzIK1eI4GToA_description
attribs.current: Miss Whisper's honeyed words are difficult for creatures to resist. Miss Whisper suggests a course of action to the target, which must be phrased in such a way as to seem like a logical course of action to the target and can't be self‑destructive or obviously against the target's self-interest. The target must attempt a Will save.

attribs.name: repeating_spellinnate_-NJR9o9jZzIK1eI4GToB_description
attribs.current: The target can understand all words regardless of language and also speak the languages of other creatures. When in a mixed group of creatures, each time the target speaks, it can choose a creature and speak in a language that creature understands, even if the target doesn't know what language that is.

attribs.name: repeating_spellinnate_-NJR9o9jZzIK1eI4GToC_description
attribs.current: Miss Whisper sees things within 60 feet as they actually are. The GM rolls a secret counteract check against any illusion or transmutation in the area, but only for the purpose of determining whether Miss Whisper sees through it (for instance, if the check succeeds against a polymorph spell, Miss Whisper can see the creature's true form, but she doesn't end the polymorph spell).

attribs.name: repeating_spellinnate_-NJR9o9jZzIK1eI4GTo6_heightened
attribs.current: Heightened (8th) Miss Whisper can target up to 5 creatures. If a creature uses a hostile action or reaction that affects multiple targets simultaneously, it needs to attempt only one save against mask of terror.

attribs.name: repeating_spellinnate_-NJR9o9jZzIK1eI4GTo6_save_failure
attribs.current: The creature becomes frightened 2 before using its action.

attribs.name: repeating_spellinnate_-NJR9o9jZzIK1eI4GTo6_save_critical_failure
attribs.current: The creature becomes frightened 2, and its action fails and is wasted.

attribs.name: repeating_spellinnate_-NJR9o9jZzIK1eI4GTo7_duration
attribs.current: Until the Next Time Miss Whisper Makes Her Daily Preparations

attribs.name: repeating_spellinnate_-NJR9o9jZzIK1eI4GTo7_save_failure
attribs.current: Miss Whisper controlS the target. It gains the controlled condition, but it can attempt a Will save at the end of each of its turns. On a success, the spell ends.

attribs.name: repeating_spellinnate_-NJR9o9jZzIK1eI4GTo7_save_success
attribs.current: The target is stunned 1 as it fights off your commands.

attribs.name: repeating_spellinnate_-NJR9o9jZzIK1eI4GTo7_save_critical_failure
attribs.current: As a failure, but the target receives a new save only if Miss Whisper gives it a new order that is against its nature, such as killing its allies.

attribs.name: repeating_spellinnate_-NJR9o9jZzIK1eI4GTo8_heightened
attribs.current:
Heightened (4th) The duration lasts until the next time Miss Whisper makes her daily preparations.
Heightened (8th) The duration lasts until the next time Miss Whisper makes her daily preparations, and she can target up to 10 creatures.

attribs.name: repeating_spellinnate_-NJR9o9jZzIK1eI4GTo8_save_failure
attribs.current: The target 's attitude becomes friendly toward Miss Whisper. If it was friendly, it becomes helpful. It can 't use hostile actions against Miss Whisper.

attribs.name: repeating_spellinnate_-NJR9o9jZzIK1eI4GTo8_save_success
attribs.current: The target is unaffected but thinks Miss Whisper's spell was something harmless instead of charm, unless it identifies the spell (usually by using Identifying Magic, see Identifying Spells).

attribs.name: repeating_spellinnate_-NJR9o9jZzIK1eI4GTo8_save_critical_failure
attribs.current: The target 's attitude becomes helpful toward Miss Whisper, and it can 't use hostile actions against her.

attribs.name: repeating_spellinnate_-NJR9o9jZzIK1eI4GTo8_save_critical_success
attribs.current: The target is unaffected and aware Miss Whisper tried to charm it.

attribs.name: repeating_spellinnate_-NJR9o9jZzIK1eI4GTo9_save_failure
attribs.current: Any emotion effects that would affect the creature are suppressed and the creature can't use hostile actions. If the target is subject to hostility from any other creature, it ceases to be affected by calm emotions.

attribs.name: repeating_spellinnate_-NJR9o9jZzIK1eI4GTo9_save_success
attribs.current: Calming urges impose a -1 status penalty to the creature's attack rolls.

attribs.name: repeating_spellinnate_-NJR9o9jZzIK1eI4GTo9_save_critical_failure
attribs.current: As failure, but hostility doesn't end the effect.

attribs.name: repeating_spellinnate_-NJR9o9jZzIK1eI4GToA_heightened
attribs.current: Heightened (8th) Miss Whisper can target up to 10 creatures.

attribs.name: repeating_spellinnate_-NJR9o9jZzIK1eI4GToA_save_failure
attribs.current: The target immediately follows Miss Whisper's suggestion. The spell has a duration of 1 minute, or until the target has completed a finite suggestion or the suggestion becomes self-destructive or has other obvious negative effects.

attribs.name: repeating_spellinnate_-NJR9o9jZzIK1eI4GToA_save_success
attribs.current: The target is unaffected and thinks Miss Whisper was talking to them normally, not casting a spell on them.

attribs.name: repeating_spellinnate_-NJR9o9jZzIK1eI4GToA_save_critical_failure
attribs.current: As failure, but the base duration is 1 hour.

attribs.name: repeating_spellinnate_-NJR9o9jZzIK1eI4GToA_save_critical_success
attribs.current: The target is unaffected and knows Miss Whisper tried to control it.

attribs.name: repeating_spellinnate_-NKXmzUXIB4yft7TZyQK_heightened
attribs.current:
Heightened (3rd) Miss Whisper learns the school of magic for the highest-level effect within range that the spell detects. If multiple effects are equally strong, the GM determines which she learns.
Heightened (4th) As 3rd level, but Miss Whisper also pinpoints the source of the highest-level magic. Like for an imprecise sense, Miss Whisper doesn't learn the exact location, but can narrow down the source to within a 5-foot cube (or the nearest if larger than that).

attribs.name: repeating_spellinnate_-NKXmzUXIB4yft7TZyQK_description
attribs.current:
Miss Whisper sends out a pulse that registers the presence of magic. Miss Whisper receives no information beyond the presence or absence of magic. Miss Whisper can choose to ignore magic she's fully aware of, such as the magic items and ongoing spells of her and her allies.
Miss Whisper detects illusion magic only if that magic's effect has a lower level than the level of her detect magic spell. However, items that have an illusion aura but aren't deceptive in appearance (such as an invisibility potion) typically are detected normally.

attribs.name: languages
attribs.current: Abyssal, Celestial, Infernal, Requian; Telepathy 100 feet, Tongues

attribs.name: repeating_interaction-abilities_-NJRA2NBaFbuZsfJIvbx_description
attribs.current: A sahkil’s level is considered 2 lower for the purpose of being conjured by the planar binding ritual (and potentially other rituals, at the GM’s discretion), but it is always free to attack or leave instead of negotiate unless the primary caster’s check is a critical success.

attribs.name: repeating_interaction-abilities_-NJRA2NBaFbuZsfJIvby_description
attribs.current:
1,000 feet. Creatures within the aura take a –2 circumstance penalty to all saving throws against poisons, diseases, and drugs. 
A monster’s aura automatically affects everything within a specified emanation around that monster. The monster doesn’t need to spend actions on the aura; rather, the aura’s effects are applied at specific times, such as when a creature ends its turn in the aura or when creatures enter the aura. If an aura does nothing but deal damage, its entry lists only the radius, damage, and saving throw. Such auras deal this damage to a creature when the creature enters the aura and when a creature starts its turn in the aura. A creature can take damage from the aura only once per round. The GM might determine that a monster’s aura doesn’t affect its own allies. For example, a creature might be immune to a monster’s frightful presence if they have been around each other for a long time.

attribs.name: repeating_actions-activities_-NJRA2NBaFbuZsfJIvc0_rep_traits
attribs.current: Curse, Divine, Emotion, Enchantment, Incapacitation, Mental

attribs.name: repeating_actions-activities_-NJRA2NBaFbuZsfJIvc0_description
attribs.current:
Frequency: once per day; 
Effect: The ximtal attempts to isolate its enemy’s companions, forcing an impression that each creature’s friends and allies have vanished and they are all alone against an insurmountable threat. The ximtal chooses up to four creatures, each of whom must be adjacent to one other target. Each target must attempt a DC 40 Will save. On a failure, a target becomes out of phase with all allies. The affected creatures can’t perceive their allies or interact with them in any way, and they can move into allies’ spaces as if their allies simply weren’t there. Allies similarly can’t perceive or interact with the affected creatures with one exception: an ally can target an effected creature with remove curse to remove the effects. Every 24 hours, an affected creature can attempt a new saving throw to end this effect.

attribs.name: repeating_actions-activities_-NJRA2NBaFbuZsfJIvc1_description
attribs.current: A ximtal’s withering attacks cause a debilitating disease targeting the senses; Saving Throw: DC 38 Fortitude; Stage 1: creature loses one sense determined randomly: taste, smell, hearing, or sight (1 day); Stage 2: creature loses an additional sense from the stage 1 list (1 day); Stage 3: creature loses an additional sense from the stage 1 list (1 day); Stage 4: creature loses the last sense from the stage 1 list and any special senses, such as tremorsense or lifesense (1 day); Stage 5: all lost senses are permanent unless restored via restore senses or a similar effect.

attribs.name: repeating_actions-activities_-NJRA2NBaFbuZsfJIvc2_description
attribs.current: The sahkil moves from the Material Plane to the Ethereal Plane or vice-versa, with the effects of ethereal jaunt except that the effect has an unlimited duration and can be Dismissed. A summoned sahkil can’t use Skip Between.

attribs.name: repeating_actions-activities_-NJRA2NBaFbuZsfJIvc3_description
attribs.current: DC 40; 8th fear (at will), horrid wilting (×3), maze (×3), suggestion (at will); Cantrips (9th) detect magic; Constant (9th) fly, true seeing

attribs.name: repeating_spellinnate_-NJRA2NBaFbuZsfJIvc4_description
attribs.current: A ximtal plant fear in the target; it must attempt a Will save.

attribs.name: repeating_spellinnate_-NJRA2NBaFbuZsfJIvc5_description
attribs.current: A ximtal pulls the moisture from the targets' bodies, dealing 10d10 negative damage. Creatures made of water (such as water elementals) and plant creatures use the outcome for one degree of success worse than the result of their saving throw. Creatures whose bodies contain no significant moisture (such as earth elementals) are immune to horrid wilting.

attribs.name: repeating_spellinnate_-NJRA2NBaFbuZsfJIvc6_description
attribs.current:
A ximtal transports the target into an extradimensional maze of eldritch origin and trap it there. Once each turn, the target can spend 1 action to attempt a Survival check or Perception check against your spell DC to escape the maze.
Teleportation magic doesn't help the creature escape unless the magic can transport across planes, such as plane shift. When the spell ends, either because the target escaped or the duration ran out, the target returns to the space it occupied when it was banished, or to the nearest space if the original is now filled.

attribs.name: repeating_spellinnate_-NJRA2NBaFbuZsfJIvc7_description
attribs.current: A ximtal's honeyed words are difficult for creatures to resist. The ximtal suggests a course of action to the target, which must be phrased in such a way as to seem like a logical course of action to the target and can't be self‑destructive or obviously against the target's self-interest. The target must attempt a Will save.

attribs.name: repeating_spellinnate_-NJRA2NBaFbuZsfJIvc8_description
attribs.current: The target can soar through the air, gaining a fly Speed equal to its Speed or 20 feet, whichever is greater.

attribs.name: repeating_spellinnate_-NJRA2NBaFbuZsfJIvc9_description
attribs.current: A ximtal sees things within 60 feet as they actually are. The GM rolls a secret counteract check against any illusion or transmutation in the area, but only for the purpose of determining whether the ximtal sees through it (for instance, if the check succeeds against a polymorph spell, the ximtal can see the creature's true form, but it doesn't end the polymorph spell).

attribs.name: repeating_spellinnate_-NJRA2NBaFbuZsfJIvc4_heightened
attribs.current: Heightened (3rd) A ximtal can target up to five creatures.

attribs.name: repeating_spellinnate_-NJRA2NBaFbuZsfJIvc4_save_critical_failure
attribs.current: The target is frightened 3 and fleeing for 1 round.

attribs.name: repeating_spellinnate_-NJRA2NBaFbuZsfJIvc6_save_failure
attribs.current: The target makes no progress toward escape.

attribs.name: repeating_spellinnate_-NJRA2NBaFbuZsfJIvc6_save_success
attribs.current: The target is on the right path to the exit. If the target was already on the right path, it escapes the maze and the spell ends.

attribs.name: repeating_spellinnate_-NJRA2NBaFbuZsfJIvc6_save_critical_failure
attribs.current: The target makes no progress toward escape, and if it was on the right path, it no longer is.

attribs.name: repeating_spellinnate_-NJRA2NBaFbuZsfJIvc6_save_critical_success
attribs.current: The target escapes and the spell ends.

attribs.name: repeating_spellinnate_-NJRA2NBaFbuZsfJIvc7_heightened
attribs.current: Heightened (8th) A ximtal can target up to 10 creatures.

attribs.name: repeating_spellinnate_-NJRA2NBaFbuZsfJIvc7_save_failure
attribs.current: The target immediately follows the ximtal's suggestion. The spell has a duration of 1 minute, or until the target has completed a finite suggestion or the suggestion becomes self-destructive or has other obvious negative effects.

attribs.name: repeating_spellinnate_-NJRA2NBaFbuZsfJIvc7_save_success
attribs.current: The target is unaffected and thinks the ximtal was talking to them normally, not casting a spell on them.

attribs.name: repeating_spellinnate_-NJRA2NBaFbuZsfJIvc7_save_critical_failure
attribs.current: As failure, but the base duration is 1 hour.

attribs.name: repeating_spellinnate_-NJRA2NBaFbuZsfJIvc7_save_critical_success
attribs.current: The target is unaffected and knows the ximtal tried to control it.

attribs.name: repeating_spellinnate_-NJRA2NBaFbuZsfJIvc8_heightened
attribs.current: Heightened (7th) The duration increases to 1 hour.

attribs.name: repeating_spellinnate_-NKYJZsTiMr-9rOt9rzx_heightened
attribs.current:
Heightened (3rd) A ximtal learns the school of magic for the highest-level effect within range that the spell detects. If multiple effects are equally strong, the GM determines which it learns.
Heightened (4th) As 3rd level, but a ximtal also pinpoints the source of the highest-level magic. Like for an imprecise sense, the ximtal doesn't learn the exact location, but can narrow down the source to within a 5-foot cube (or the nearest if larger than that).

attribs.name: repeating_spellinnate_-NKYJZsTiMr-9rOt9rzx_description
attribs.current:
A ximtal sends out a pulse that registers the presence of magic. The ximtal receivse no information beyond the presence or absence of magic. The ximtal can choose to ignore magic it's fully aware of, such as the magic items and ongoing spells of it and its allies.
The ximtal detects illusion magic only if that magic's effect has a lower level than the level of its detect magic spell. However, items that have an illusion aura but aren't deceptive in appearance (such as an invisibility potion) typically are detected normally.

attribs.name: repeating_spellfocus_-NJRAozn9Z3JsLs2K1Gl_description
attribs.current: Calance's performance protects her and her allies. Roll a Performance check for a type Calance knows: an auditory performance if the trigger was auditory, or a visual one for a visual trigger. Calance and allies in the area can use the better result between his Performance check and the saving throw.

attribs.name: repeating_normalspells_-NJRAozn9Z3JsLs2K1Gm_description
attribs.current: With a cursory mental touch, Calance attempts to read the target's mind. It must attempt a Will save. The target then becomes temporarily immune to Calance's mind reading for 1 hour.

attribs.name: repeating_normalspells_-NJRAozn9Z3JsLs2K1Gn_description
attribs.current: Calance graces the target's mind, boosting its mental defenses and healing its wounds. The target regains 1d10+4 Hit Points when Calance Cast the Spell and gains a +2 status bonus to saves against mental effects for the duration.

attribs.name: repeating_normalspells_-NJRAozn9Z3JsLs2K1Go_description
attribs.current: Calance designates an area in which creatures are compelled to speak only truth. Creatures within or entering the area have difficulty lying. Each potentially affected creature must attempt a Will save when the spell is cast or when the creature first enters the area. It uses the results of this initial save if it leaves and reenters the area. Affected creatures are aware of this enchantment; therefore, they can avoid answering questions to which they would normally respond with a lie, or they can be evasive as long as they remain within the boundaries of the truth.

attribs.name: repeating_normalspells_-NJRAozn9Z3JsLs2K1Gp_description
attribs.current:
Calance gains a vague glimpse of the future. During the casting of this spell, ask about the results of a particular course of action. The spell can predict results up to 30 minutes into the future and reveals the GM’s best guess among the following outcomes:
• Weal The results will be good.
• Woe The results will be bad.
• Weal and Woe The results will be a mix of good and bad.
• Nothing There won’t be particularly good or bad results.
The GM rolls a secret DC 6 flat check. On a failure, the result is always “nothing.” This makes it impossible to tell whether a “nothing” result is accurate. If anyone asks about the same topic as the first casting of augury during an additional casting, the GM uses the secret roll result from the first casting. If circumstances change, though, it’s possible to get a different result.

attribs.name: repeating_normalspells_-NJRAozn9Z3JsLs2K1Gq_description
attribs.current:
Restorative magic counters the effects of toxins or conditions that prevent a creature from functioning at its best. When Calance casts restoration, choose to either reduce a condition or lessen the effect of a toxin. A creature can benefit from only one restoration spell each day, and it can't benefit from restoration more than once to reduce the stage of the same exposure to a given toxin.
• Reduce a Condition Reduce the value of the target's clumsy, enfeebled, or stupefied condition by 2. Calance can instead reduce two of the listed conditions by 1 each.
• Lessen a Toxin Reduce the stage of one toxin the target suffers from by one stage. This can't reduce the stage below stage 1 or cure the affliction.

attribs.name: repeating_normalspells_-NJRAozn9Z3JsLs2K1Gr_description
attribs.current: Calance graces the target's mind, boosting its mental defenses and healing its wounds. The target regains 1d10+4 Hit Points when Calance Cast the Spell and gains a +2 status bonus to saves against mental effects for the duration.

attribs.name: repeating_normalspells_-NJRAozn9Z3JsLs2K1Gs_description
attribs.current: Calance dulls the target's mind; the target must attempt a Will save.

attribs.name: repeating_normalspells_-NJRAozn9Z3JsLs2K1Gt_description
attribs.current:
To the target, Calance's words are honey and his visage seems bathed in a dreamy haze. It must attempt a Will save, with a +4 circumstance bonus if Calance or his allies recently threatened it or used hostile actions against it. 
Calance can Dismiss the spell. If Calance uses hostile actions against the target, the spell ends. When the spell ends, the target doesn 't necessarily realize it was charmed unless its friendship with Calance or the actions him convinced it to take clash with its expectations, meaning he could potentially convince the target to continue being his friend via mundane means.

attribs.name: repeating_normalspells_-NJRAozn9Z3JsLs2K1Gu_description
attribs.current: Calance wards himself with shimmering magical energy, gaining a +1 item bonus to AC and a maximum Dexterity modifier of +5. While wearing mage armour, Calance uses his unarmored proficiency to calculate his AC.

attribs.name: repeating_normalspells_-NJRAozn9Z3JsLs2K1Gv_description
attribs.current: Calance sends a dart of force streaking toward a creature that he can see. It automatically hits and deals 1d4+1 force damage. For each additional action Calance uses when Casting the Spell, increase the number of missiles he shoots by one, to a maximum of three missiles for 3 actions. Calance chooses the target for each missile individually. If Calance shoots more than one missile at the same target, combine the damage before applying bonuses or penalties to damage, resistances, weaknesses, and so forth.

attribs.name: repeating_normalspells_-NJRAozn9Z3JsLs2K1Gw_description
attribs.current: Calance graces the target's mind, boosting its mental defenses and healing its wounds. The target regains 1d10+4 Hit Points when Calance Cast the Spell and gains a +2 status bonus to saves against mental effects for the duration.

attribs.current: The target takes a –2 status penalty to Deception checks.

Heightened (8th) The item bonus to AC increases to +2, and Calance gains a +2 item bonus to saving throws.

attribs.name: repeating_cantrip_-NKZ6ZEq2hn8RQqYhPsy_description
attribs.current:
Siphoning negative energy into himself, Calance's hand radiates a pale darkness. Calance's touch weakens the living and disorients undead, possibly even causing them to flee. The effect depends on whether the target is living or undead.
• Living Creature The spell deals negative damage equal to 1d4 plus Calance's charisma modifier. The target attempts a basic Fortitude save, but is also enfeebled 1 for 1 round on a critical failure.
• Undead Creature The target is flat-footed for 1 round on a failed Fortitude save. On a critical failure, the target is also fleeing for 1 round unless it succeeds at a Will save.

attribs.name: repeating_cantrip_-NKZ6bG2RVCxlMKjqRoG_description
attribs.current: Calance clouds the target's mind and daze it with a mental jolt. The jolt deals mental damage equal to Calance's charisma modifier; the target must attempt a basic Will save. If the target critically fails the save, it is also stunned 1.

attribs.name: repeating_cantrip_-NKZ6cYoXmAhWWEZWdRq_target
attribs.current: 1 Object of 1 Bulk or Less, Either Unattended or Possessed by Calance or a Willing Ally

attribs.current: Heightened (4th) The object sheds bright light in a 60-foot radius (and dim light for the next 60 feet).

attribs.name: repeating_cantrip_-NKZ6cYoXmAhWWEZWdRq_description
attribs.current: The object glows, casting bright light in a 20-foot radius (and dim light for the next 20 feet) like a torch. If you cast this spell again on a second object, the light spell on the first object ends.

attribs.name: repeating_cantrip_-NKZ6eMXIxZ1iMWVCfaZ_description
attribs.current:
The simplest magic does Calance's bidding. Calance can perform simple magical effects for as long as he Sustain the Spell. Each time Calance Sustain the Spell, he can choose one of four options.
• Cook Cool, warm, or flavour 1 pound of nonliving material.
• Lift Slowly lift an unattended object of light Bulk or less 1 foot off the ground.
• Make Create a temporary object of negligible Bulk, made of congealed magical substance. The object looks crude and artificial and is extremely fragile—it can't be used as a tool, weapon, or spell component.
• Tidy Colour, clean, or soil an object of light Bulk or less. Calance can affect an object of 1 Bulk with 10 rounds of concentration, and a larger object a 1 minute per Bulk.
Prestidigitation can't deal damage or cause adverse conditions. Any actual change to an object (beyond what is noted above) persists only as long as Calance Sustain the Spell.

attribs.name: repeating_cantrip_-NKZ6fddvloaB7Ilqh3K_duration
attribs.current: Until the Start of Calance Next Turn

attribs.name: repeating_cantrip_-NKZ6fddvloaB7Ilqh3K_heightened
attribs.current:
Heightening the spell increases the shield's Hardness.
Heightened (3rd) The shield has Hardness 10.
Heightened (5th) The shield has Hardness 15.
Heightened (7th) The shield has Hardness 20.
Heightened (9th) The shield has Hardness 25.

attribs.name: repeating_cantrip_-NKZ6fddvloaB7Ilqh3K_description
attribs.current:
Calance raises a magical shield of force. This counts as using the Raise a Shield action, giving Calance a +1 circumstance bonus to AC until the start of his next turn, but it doesn't require a hand to use.
While the spell is in effect, Calance can use the Shield Block reaction with his magic shield (see the sidebar). The shield has Hardness 5. After Calance uses Shield Block, the spell ends and he can't cast it again for 10 minutes. Unlike a normal Shield Block, Calance can use the spell's reaction against the magic missile spell.

attribs.name: repeating_spellfocus_-NKZ6jqSHsbkZrTtzIjB_description
attribs.current:
Calance's encouragement inspires his ally to succeed at a task. This counts as having taken sufficient preparatory actions to Aid Calance's ally on a skill check of his choice, regardless of the circumstances. When Calance later uses the Aid reaction, he can roll Performance instead of the normal skill check, and if he rolls a failure, he gets a success instead.
The GM might rule that you can't use this ability if the act of encouraging Calance's ally would interfere with the skill check (such as a check to Sneak quietly or maintain a disguise).

attribs.name: repeating_spellfocus_-NKZ6lEZZuFuCAQhamdL_description
attribs.current: Calance inspires his allies with words or tunes of encouragement. Calance and all allies in the area gain a +1 status bonus to attack rolls, damage rolls, and saves against fear effects.

attribs.name: repeating_spellfocus_-NKZ6m0h6oDWrUEAh3m0_description
attribs.current: Calance inspires his allies to protect themselves more effectively. Calance and all allies in the area gain a +1 status bonus to AC and saving throws, as well as resistance equal to half the spell's level to physical damage.

attribs.name: saving_throws_notes
attribs.current: +2 Status to All Saves vs. Magic

attribs.name: repeating_interaction-abilities_-NJXtcIGSFYcU0uYF2-Z_description
attribs.current: When first exposed to bright light, Angobo is blinded until the end of its next turn. After this exposure, light doesn’t blind Angobo again until after it spends 1 hour in darkness. However, as long as Angobo is in an area of bright light, it’s dazzled.

attribs.name: repeating_interaction-abilities_-NJXtcIGSFYcU0uYF2-a_description
attribs.current: Angobo can use their Bardic Lore skill to Recall Knowledge on any topic, and they know any languages common to an area they have spent a day or more in.

attribs.name: repeating_actions-activities_-NJXtcIGSFYcU0uYF2-c_description
repeating_actions-activities_-NJXtcIGSFYcU0uYF2-d_description
attribs.current:
A creature hit by Angobo’s fist Strike must attempt a DC 38 Will save. The creature is then temporarily immune until start of its next turn. 
Critical Success: The creature is unaffected.  
Success: The creature is stunned 1. 
Failure: The creature is stunned 2.
Critical Failure: The creature is stunned 3 and Angobo can use Steal Memories on the target as part of this action.

attribs.name: repeating_actions-activities_-NJXtcIGSFYcU0uYF2-e_description
attribs.current: Angobo reaches out with their mind and attempts to steal memories from a creature within 30 feet. The target must succeed at a DC 42 Will saving throw or become stupefied 2 and have some of its memories stolen. Angobo learns some of the target’s memories (chosen by the GM), which are then lost to the target.

attribs.name: repeating_actions-activities_-NJXtcIGSFYcU0uYF2-f_description
attribs.current: DC 42, attack +32; 8th: charm (×2), disappearance, mind blank; 7th: dispel magic (×2), mindlink (at will); 4th: air walk (at will), hypercognition (at will), zone of truth (at will); Cantrips (8th): daze, detect magic, read aura

attribs.name: repeating_spellinnate_-NJXtcIH0kzJWvoLWYST_description
attribs.current:
To the target, Angobo's words are honey and its visage seems bathed in a dreamy haze. It must attempt a Will save, with a +4 circumstance bonus if Angobo or its allies recently threatened it or used hostile actions against it. 
Angobo can Dismiss the spell. If Angobo uses hostile actions against the target, the spell ends. When the spell ends, the target doesn 't necessarily realize it was charmed unless its friendship with Angobo or the actions it convinced it to take clash with its expectations, meaning it could potentially convince the target to continue being it friend via mundane means.

attribs.name: repeating_spellinnate_-NJXtcIH0kzJWvoLWYSU_description
attribs.current: Angobo shrouds a creature from others' senses. The target becomes undetected, not just to sight but to all senses, allowing the target to count as invisible no matter what precise and imprecise senses an observer might have. It's still possible for a creature to find the target by Seeking, looking for disturbed dust, hearing gaps in the sound spectrum, or finding some other way to discover the presence of an otherwise-undetectable creature.

attribs.name: repeating_spellinnate_-NJXtcIH0kzJWvoLWYSV_description
attribs.current: Powerful wards hide a creature from divination magic. The target gains a +4 status bonus to saves against mental effects. Mind blank attempts to counteract any detection, revelation, and scrying effects as if its spell level were 1 higher than its actual level. On a success, the divination effect functions normally except that it detects nothing about the target and its possessions. For instance, detect magic would still detect other magic in the area, but not any magic on the target.

attribs.name: repeating_spellinnate_-NJXtcIH0kzJWvoLWYSW_description
attribs.current: Angobo unravels the magic behind a spell or effect. Attempt a counteract check against the target. Counteracting a Magic Item causes it to become mundane for 10 minutes. This doesn't change the item's non-magical properties. If the target is an artefact or similar item, Angobo automatically fails.

attribs.name: repeating_spellinnate_-NJXtcIH0kzJWvoLWYSX_description
attribs.current: Angobo links its mind to the target's mind and mentally impart to that target an amount of information in an instant that could otherwise be communicated in 10 minutes.

attribs.name: repeating_spellinnate_-NJXtcIH0kzJWvoLWYSY_description
attribs.current: The target can walk on air as if it were solid ground. It can ascend and descend in this way at a maximum of a 45-degree angle.

attribs.name: repeating_spellinnate_-NJXtcIH0kzJWvoLWYSZ_description
attribs.current: Angobo designates an area in which creatures are compelled to speak only truth. Creatures within or entering the area have difficulty lying. Each potentially affected creature must attempt a Will save when the spell is cast or when the creature first enters the area. It uses the results of this initial save if it leaves and reenters the area. Affected creatures are aware of this enchantment; therefore, they can avoid answering questions to which they would normally respond with a lie, or they can be evasive as long as they remain within the boundaries of the truth.

attribs.name: repeating_spellinnate_-NJXtcIH0kzJWvoLWYST_heightened
attribs.current:
Heightened (4th) The duration lasts until the next time Angobo makes its daily preparations.
Heightened (8th) The duration lasts until the next time Angobo makes its daily preparations, and it can target up to 10 creatures.

attribs.name: repeating_spellinnate_-NJXtcIH0kzJWvoLWYST_save_failure
attribs.current: The target 's attitude becomes friendly toward Angobo. If it was friendly, it becomes helpful. It can 't use hostile actions against Angobo.

attribs.name: repeating_spellinnate_-NJXtcIH0kzJWvoLWYST_save_success
attribs.current: The target is unaffected but thinks Angobo's spell was something harmless instead of charm, unless it identifies the spell (usually by using Identifying Magic, see Identifying Spells).

attribs.name: repeating_spellinnate_-NJXtcIH0kzJWvoLWYST_save_critical_failure
attribs.current: The target 's attitude becomes helpful toward Angobo, and it can 't use hostile actions against it.

attribs.name: repeating_spellinnate_-NJXtcIH0kzJWvoLWYST_save_critical_success
attribs.current: The target is unaffected and aware Angobo tried to charm it.

attribs.name: repeating_spellinnate_-NJXtcIH0kzJWvoLWYSV_duration
attribs.current: Until the Next Time Angobo Makes Its Daily Preparations

attribs.name: repeating_spellinnate_-NJXtcIH0kzJWvoLWYSW_target
attribs.current: 1 Spell Effect or Unattended Magic Item

attribs.name: repeating_spellinnate_-NJXtcIH0kzJWvoLWYSZ_save_critical_failure
attribs.current: The target can't speak any deliberate and intentional lies and takes a –4 status penalty to Deception checks.

attribs.name: repeating_spellinnate_-NJXtcIH0kzJWvoLWYSZ_save_failure
attribs.current: The target can't speak any deliberate and intentional lies, and it takes a –2 status penalty to Deception checks.

attribs.name: repeating_spellinnate_-NJXtcIH0kzJWvoLWYSZ_save_success
attribs.current: The target takes a –2 status penalty to Deception checks.

attribs.name: repeating_spellinnate_-NL730OXjiWUVZQk0Rdv_description
attribs.current: Angobo rapidly catalogues and collates information relevant to its current situation. Angobo can instantly use up to 6 Recall Knowledge actions as part of Casting this Spell. For these actions, Angobo can't use any special abilities, reactions, or free actions that trigger when it Recall Knowledge.

attribs.name: repeating_spellinnate_-NL73CgMRQrp1-fTf6tZ_description
attribs.current: Angobo clouds the target's mind and dazes it with a mental jolt. The jolt deals mental damage equal to Angobo's charisma modifier; the target must attempt a basic Will save. If the target critically fails the save, it is also stunned 1.

attribs.name: repeating_spellinnate_-NL73Dw1s5YZZvGbTxKm_heightened
attribs.current:
Heightened (3rd) Angobo learns the school of magic for the highest-level effect within range that the spell detects. If multiple effects are equally strong, the GM determines which Angobo learns.
Heightened (4th) As 3rd level, but Angobo also pinpoints the source of the highest-level magic. Like for an imprecise sense, Angobo doesn't learn the exact location, but can narrow down the source to within a 5-foot cube (or the nearest if larger than that).

attribs.name: repeating_spellinnate_-NL73Dw1s5YZZvGbTxKm_description
attribs.current:
Angobo sends out a pulse that registers the presence of magic. Angobo receives no information beyond the presence or absence of magic. Angobo can choose to ignore magic it's fully aware of, such as the magic items and ongoing spells of it and its allies.
Angobo detects illusion magic only if that magic's effect has a lower level than the level of its detect magic spell. However, items that have an illusion aura but aren't deceptive in appearance (such as an invisibility potion) typically are detected normally.

attribs.name: repeating_spellinnate_-NL73FS6zkjaiWJYNLiA_heightened
attribs.current:
Heightened (3rd) Angobo can target up to 10 objects.
Heightened (6th) Angobo can target any number of objects.

attribs.name: repeating_spellinnate_-NL73FS6zkjaiWJYNLiA_description
attribs.current:
Angobo focuses on the target object, opening its mind to perceive magical auras. When the casting is complete, Angobo knows whether that item is magical, and if it is, it learns the school of magic.
If the object is illusory, Angobo detects this only if the effect's level is lower than the level of its read aura spell.

attribs.name: repeating_actions-activities_-NKZF7-lxQGeTx34khcc_description
attribs.current: The Gray Gardener assassin distracts a creature within 30 feet, using a few choice words or gestures. The creature is flat-footed against the assassin’s attacks until the end of the assassin’s next turn. Depending on the distraction, this action gains either the auditory or the visual trait.

attribs.name: repeating_actions-activities_-NKZFE2ZuEIliKIA3W6q_description
attribs.current: The Gray Gardener assassin designates a single creature they can see and hear as their mark. This effect lasts until the mark dies or the assassin uses Mark for Death again. The assassin gains a +2 circumstance bonus to Perception checks to Seek the mark and on Deception checks to Feint against the mark. The assassin’s melee and ranged Strikes gain the deadly d8 weapon traits when attacking the mark.

attribs.name: repeating_actions-activities_-NKZFIqsF9AWVp5tm2Ih_description
attribs.current: Requirements The Gray Gardener assassin is wielding a piercing or slashing weapon and has a free hand; Effect The assassin applies a poison to the weapon.

attribs.name: repeating_actions-activities_-NKZFNUVxZvdMVN-F5uq_description
attribs.current: The Gray Gardener assassin Interacts to draw a weapon and then Strikes with that weapon.

attribs.name: repeating_actions-activities_-NKZFSV2WvsXNurWmL8F_description
attribs.current: The Gray Gardener assassin deals an additional [[6d6]] (6d6) precision damage to flat-footed creatures.

attribs.name: repeating_actions-activities_-NKZFWllVs-ci-du22qg_description
attribs.current: On the first round of combat, creatures that haven’t acted yet are flat-footed to the Gray Gardener assassin.

attribs.name: repeating_free-actions-reactions_-NKZEsi6Ff3jQrGOZSqp_description
attribs.current: The Gray Gardener assassin has a +2 circumstance bonus to Deception checks and saving throws to conceal their identity and a +2 circumstance bonus to their Deception DC against effects that ferret out information about the Gray Gardener’s identity.

attribs.name: repeating_free-actions-reactions_-NKZEtwstFZoFW8EokGe_trigger
attribs.current: The Gray Gardener assassin rolls a failure (but not a critical failure) on a Will save against an effect with the mental or fear trait;

attribs.name: repeating_free-actions-reactions_-NKZEtwstFZoFW8EokGe_description
attribs.current: Requirements The Gray Gardener enforcer’s features are obscured by a mask or hood; Effect The Gray Gardener assassin takes [[3d8]] (3d8) mental damage, and the saving throw is a success.

attribs.name: repeating_actions-activities_-NKZGRAwBfNywUL6UZZo_description
attribs.current: The director general Interacts to draw a weapon, and then Strikes with that weapon.

attribs.name: repeating_actions-activities_-NKZGYAWq3q8TYPQidZc_description
attribs.current: The director general’s Strikes deal an additional [[4d6]] (4d6) precision damage to frightened creatures. If the Strike against a frightened creature is a critical hit, the creature doesn’t automatically reduce its frightened condition at the end of its next turn.

attribs.name: repeating_actions-activities_-NKZGeGWrHoELhkbZE8P_description
attribs.current: Trigger The director general’s turn begins; Effect The director general attempts to Demoralize a creature within 60 feet that they can see and that can see the director general.

attribs.name: repeating_actions-activities_-NKZGjhOu9ZjGR9etn9l_description
attribs.current: The director general utters a few words to a non-frightened target within 60 feet that can hear them, bolstering the target’s indignation of cowards. The target creature must succeed at a DC 39 Will save, or it doesn’t count frightened creatures as allies and can’t Aid them or flank with them. This effect lasts for 1 round (1 minute on a critical failure).

attribs.name: repeating_free-actions-reactions_-NKZG6BkafsEv7iBQnzA_description
attribs.current: The Gray Gardener director general has a +2 circumstance bonus to Deception checks and saving throws to conceal their identity and a +2 circumstance bonus to their Deception DC against effects that ferret out information about the Gray Gardener’s identity.

attribs.name: repeating_free-actions-reactions_-NKZG7PWVyQ0okxmGZek_trigger
attribs.current: The Gray Gardener director general rolls a failure (but not a critical failure) on a Will save against an effect with the mental or fear trait;

attribs.current: Requirements The Gray Gardener enforcer’s features are obscured by a mask or hood; Effect The Gray Gardener enforcer takes [[3d8]] (3d8) mental damage, and the saving throw is a success.

attribs.current:
{"size":"Small","Token":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/files.d20.io/images/93314031/UsFsn-nI88keYKcjH079aA/original.png","level":"12","speed":"30","nature":"21","senses":"hungersense (imprecise) 30 feet, low-light vision","traits":"Uncommon, Fey","stealth":"25","Category":"Monsters","crafting":"23","npc_type":"Creature","thievery":"25","Expansion":"4137","alignment":"LE","data-List":"false","deception":"25","languages":"Aklo, Common, Sylvan","data-items":"[{"item":"+1 striking hand crossbow (20 bolts)"}]","perception":"21","weaknesses":"cold iron 10","armor_class":"34","description":"Gimmerlings are small, shapeshifting fey who stage ambushes to sate their endless hunger and childish greed. These cruelly curious fey obsess over finding and making unusual traps and sadistic weapons, and their favorite amusement is seeing these traps sprung or the weapons wielded. When on the Material Plane, they are frequently found in urban areas, particularly slums or other parts of town where they can either go unnoticed or be easily forgotten—and have plenty of victims to choose from.
A typical gimmerling disguises itself as an endangered child, doing so in hopes of drawing creatures close enough to rob. The gimmerling puts itself in apparent danger using a trap, construct, or bribed ally, or even a coerced monster like a redcap (page 278).
Because gimmerlings sometimes trade obscure smithing or trapping techniques in exchange for gifts that sate their curiosity, their greed, or their hunger, they have at times been worshipped as minor gods of the forge. Some disciplined gimmerlings work as honored artisans, elite guards, or spies for the demigods known as the Eldest who dwell in the depths of the First World.

Gimmerling Treasure 
Gimmerlings collect weapons, traps, mechanical novelties, and dangerous magic items. A gimmerling is likely found with tools (like artisan’s tools, repair kits, and thieves’ tools) and items it can use to appear more vulnerable, such as locks, manacles, and snare kits (which it feigns being trapped by).
Gimmerling Locations
Gimmerlings are more common in the First World than on the Material Plane and favor hunting grounds on the verges of dangerous places where they might encounter protective creatures to mislead with their disguises.

attribs.name: repeating_interaction-abilities_-NJXucBE2EhMtqV5TuGU_description
attribs.current:
15 feet. Tangled roots, jagged divots, sharp rocks and other hazards appear on surfaces in the aura, creating difficult terrain. 
A monster’s aura automatically affects everything within a specified emanation around that monster. The monster doesn’t need to spend actions on the aura; rather, the aura’s effects are applied at specific times, such as when a creature ends its turn in the aura or when creatures enter the aura. If an aura does nothing but deal damage, its entry lists only the radius, damage, and saving throw. Such auras deal this damage to a creature when the creature enters the aura and when a creature starts its turn in the aura. A creature can take damage from the aura only once per round. The GM might determine that a monster’s aura doesn’t affect its own allies. For example, a creature might be immune to a monster’ frightful presence if they have been around each other for a long time.

attribs.name: repeating_actions-activities_-NJXucBE2EhMtqV5TuGZ_description
attribs.current:
The gimmerling changes into its natural form or that of any humanoid. In humanoid form, it loses its treacherous aura, and its equipment appears to be trinkets or toys. As a humanoid that lacks claws or fangs, it loses the matching Strike. If it loses its claw Strike, it gains a fist Strike that is identical except that it deals bludgeoning damage.
The monster changes its shape indefinitely. It can use this action again to return to its natural shape or adopt a new shape. Unless otherwise noted, a monster cannot use Change Shape to appear as a specific individual. Using Change Shape counts as creating a disguise for the Impersonate use of Deception. The monster’s transformation automatically defeats Perception DCs to determine whether the creature is a member of the ancestry or creature type into which it transformed, and it gains a +4 status bonus to its Deception DC to prevent others from seeing through its disguise. Change Shape abilities specify what shapes the monster can adopt. The monster doesn’t gain any special abilities of the new shape, only its physical form. For example, in each shape, it replaces its normal Speeds and Strikes, and might potentially change its senses or size. Any changes are listed in its stat block.

attribs.name: repeating_interaction-abilities_-NK-BPgS697hHR6J4GfS_description
attribs.current:
A sturzstromer’s tremorsense is a precise sense out to 120 feet and an imprecise sense out to 240 feet. It can’t sense anything beyond the range of its tremorsense. 
Tremorsense allows a monster to feel the vibrations through a solid surface caused by movement. It is an imprecise sense with a limited range (listed in the ability). Tremorsense functions only if the monster is on the same surface as the subject, and only if the subject is moving along (or burrowing through) the surface.

attribs.name: repeating_free-actions-reactions_-NK-BPgS697hHR6J4GfT_description
attribs.current:
Requirements: The sturzstromer’s most recent action was to cast earthquake. 
Effect: The sturzstromer closes a fissure it made, choosing one creature that fell in. That creature must succeed at a DC 41 Reflex save or be buried as in an avalanche.

attribs.name: repeating_spellinnate_-NK-BPgT0252cEYZ7-GB_description
attribs.current:
A sturzstromer shakes the ground, topple creatures into fissures, and collapse structures.
The GM might add additional effects in certain areas. Cliffs might collapse, causing creatures to fall, or a lake might drain as fissures open up below its surface, leaving a morass of quicksand. 
• Shaking Ground The ground is difficult terrain, and creatures on it take a –2 circumstance penalty to attack rolls, AC, and skill checks.
• Fissures Each creature on the ground must attempt a Reflex save at the start of its turn to keep its footing and avoid falling into 40-foot-deep fissures that open beneath it. The fissures are permanent, and their sides require DC 15 Athletics to Climb.
• Collapse Structures and ceilings might collapse. The GM rolls a flat check for each (DC 16 for a sturdy structure, DC 14 for an average structure and most natural formations, DC 9 for a shoddy structure, all adjusted higher or lower as the GM sees fit). A collapse deals 11d6 bludgeoning damage; each creature caught in a collapse must attempt a Reflex save to avoid it.

attribs.name: repeating_spellinnate_-NK-BPgT0252cEYZ7-GC_description
attribs.current: Using the weight of earth, a sturzstromer hampers a target's flight, with effects based on its Fortitude save. If the creature reaches the ground safely, it doesn't take falling damage.
