attribs.name: repeating_spellinnate_-NK-BPgT0252cEYZ7-GE_description
attribs.current: A sturzstromer can ask questions of, and receive answers from natural or worked stone. While stone is not intelligent, the sturzstromer speaks with the natural spirits of the stone, which have a personality coloured by the type of stone, as well as by the type of structure the stone is part of, for worked stone. A stone's perspective, perception, and knowledge give it a worldview different enough from a human's that it doesn't consider the same details important. Stones can mostly answer questions about creatures that touched them in the past and what is concealed beneath or behind them.

{"size":"Large","Token":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/files.d20.io/images/93319797/9OAzI84AogjXkIqS2qpjXg/original.png","level":"13","speed":"20","senses":"darkvision","traits":"Uncommon, Construct, Golem, Mindless","Category":"Monsters","npc_type":"Creature","Expansion":"4137","alignment":"N","athletics":"30","data-List":"false","immunities":"bleed, death effects, disease, doomed, drained, fatigued, fire, healing, magic (see golem antimagic, vulnerable to neutralize poison, vulnerable to rust), mental, necromancy, nonlethal attacks, paralyzed, poison, sickened, unconscious","perception":"21","armor_class":"34","description":"Traditionally crafted into the forms of giant suits of armor or powerful animals, iron golems are products of exquisite artistry and skill. Their articulated joints and sturdy armored bodies require great care and mathematical precision to craft, and regular cleaning and oiling ensure they don’t rust over the ages. With proper care, iron golems can remain in good shape for thousands of years, being passed down for generations, as long as they aren’t destroyed by meddlesome adventurers. In addition to their incredible strength, iron golems possess a potent toxic breath weapon that is often more than enough to dispatch entire groups of opponents.

Iron Golems
An iron golem can be melted down for scrap or traded to fire giants for repurposing into armor for a Large creature.


Crafted of base materials and then magically animated into a powerful guardian, the legendary golem is a living construct that mindlessly obeys its creator’s commands—often continuing to do so for years or even centuries after its creator’s death. There exist two known methods of animating a golem. The traditional method involves harvesting and implanting an elemental soul or essence within the newly crafted host statue, a procedure seen as vile and blasphemous to those who value the sanctity of the soul; evil or amoral golem crafters tend to prefer this method. The other, less disreputable technique involves siphoning pure positive energy into the statue to artificially imitate the creation of a soul. The result does not give the golem a true soul and is generally a more costly and time-consuming method of creation. Regardless of the method used, the resulting golem functions the same. A golem’s unique animating force leaves it susceptible to certain forms of magic, but apart from these few weaknesses, it is impervious to magic and difficult to damage with weapons.
Golems work best in play as foes to vanquish rather than allies to accompany player characters on adventures. The process of creating a golem is time-consuming, expensive, and difficult, and only the most talented spellcasters or artisans can even hope to accomplish such an undertaking. While certain magical texts—so-called “golem manuals”—are said to aid golems crafters, for the most part the creation of a golem should be something left in the hands of the Game Master.
Golems have components that can be harvested as trophies or magical components; the value depends on the golem in question. Examples of components that can be harvested from golems are listed in the sidebars.
Golem Antimagic
A golem is immune to spells and magical abilities other than its own, but each type of golem is affected by a few types of magic in special ways. These exceptions are listed in shortened form in the golem’s stat block, with the full rules appearing here. If an entry lists multiple types (such as “cold and water”), either type of spell can affect the golem.
• Harmed By Any magic of this type that targets the golem causes it to take the listed amount of damage (this damage has no type) instead of the usual effect. If the golem starts its turn in an area of magic of this type or is affected by a persistent effect of the appropriate type, it takes the damage listed in the parenthetical.
•        Healed By Any magic of this type that targets the golem makes the golem lose the slowed condition and gain HP equal to half the damage the spell would have dealt. If the golem starts its turn in an area of this type of magic, it gains the HP listed in the parenthetical.
• Slowed By Any magic of this type that targets the golem causes it to be slowed 1 for 2d6 rounds instead of the usual effect. If the golem starts its turn in an area of this type of magic, it’s slowed 1 for that round.
•        Vulnerable To Each golem is vulnerable to one or more specific spells, with the effects described in its stat block.","resistances":"physical 15 (except adamantine)","hit_points_max":"190","wisdom_modifier":"0","charisma_modifier":"-5","strength_modifier":"8","data-melee-strikes":"[{"weapon":"fist","weapon_strike":"28","weapon_traits":"magical, reach 10 feet","weapon_strike_damage":"3d10+12","weapon_strike_damage_type":"bludgeoning"}]","dexterity_modifier":"-1","saving_throws_will":"22","saving_throws_reflex":"21","constitution_modifier":"4","intelligence_modifier":"-5","data-actions-activities":"[{"name":"Breath Weapon","actions":"2","traits":"arcane, necromancy, poison","description":"The iron golem exhales poisonous gas in a 10-foot radius centered on the corner of one of the iron golem’s squares. attribs.current: The guillotine golem emits poisonous gas in a 10-foot radius centered on the corner of one of the golem’s squares. The gas persists for 1 round. Any creature in the area (or that later enters the area) is exposed to the golem’s poison. The golem can’t use its Breath Weapon again for [[1d4]] (1d4) rounds.

attribs.name: repeating_actions-activities_-NK-D7-63D62ZfDdD-jC_description
attribs.current: If the guillotine golem critically hits a creature with its blade Strike, the creature must succeed at a DC 40 Fortitude save or be decapitated, dying instantly unless it can survive without a head.

attribs.name: repeating_actions-activities_-NK-D7-63D62ZfDdD-jD_description
attribs.current: Any drained value from this poison is reduced by 1 every hour. Saving Throw DC 40 Fortitude; Maximum Duration 4 rounds; Stage 1 [[3d6]] (3d6) poison and drained 1 (1 round); Stage 2 [[5d6]] poison (5d6) and drained 2 (1 round); Stage 3 [[10d6]] (10d6) poison and drained 3 (1 round).

attribs.name: repeating_actions-activities_-NKZKaYWQZm2xcFXU-km_description
attribs.current: The guillotine golem Strides up to its Speed, pushing back each creature whose space it moves into and damaging them if they try to stop its movement. A creature can attempt to bar the way by succeeding at a DC 44 Fortitude save. On a critical success, the resisting creature takes no damage; otherwise, it is damaged as if hit by the golem’s blade Strike.

{"size":"Medium","Token":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/files.d20.io/images/93323103/mR3YcP2Sa_7LbCvykqozhw/original.png","level":"16","speed":"50","senses":"darkvision, see invisibility, status sight, true seeing","traits":"Rare, Undead","society":"26","stealth":"35","Category":"Monsters","npc_type":"Creature","religion":"30","spell_dc":"38","Expansion":"4137","alignment":"NE","athletics":"28","data-List":"false","deception":"30","languages":"Common, Necril","acrobatics":"33","data-items":"[{"item":"scythe"}]","immunities":"death effects, disease, paralyzed, poison, unconscious","perception":"32","armor_class":"39","description":"No one is quite sure what lesser deaths are, though some claim that they are avatars of the grim reaper. Unlike that strange hunter, however, lesser deaths hunt in packs on rare occasions. More often than not, they manifest from cursed magic items. Other times, they are just the enactors of death, hunting in the same way the grim reaper does—silently, with neither remorse nor quarter. Rarely, multiple lesser deaths work together to cull a large population, their scythes cutting through crowds and leaving entire cities devoid of life, inspiring (hopefully) false rumors of multiple grim reapers.

The Grim Reaper is the unflinching personification of death. Silent as the grave and as inevitable as time itself, this legendary being hunts down and finishes creatures that have evaded death for far too long. Sometimes the Grim Reaper comes without warning, while at others it comes to finish the work that other creatures could not. The Grim Reaper serves no god, fiend, or aeon. It is both despised and feared by psychopomps and celestials, but few—if any—dare to stand in its way. Like some eternal plague, it kills those who try to cure the multiverse of its presence. It stands alone and holds only its own council, and the pleading and reasoning of mortals and immortals alike fall on deaf ears once the Grim Reaper closes on its quarry. Its own reasoning is silent to mortal ears and inscrutable to the mortal mind, but no matter the reason, the result is unyielding and final.
While some legends hold that the Grim Reaper appears before everyone as they die, the truth is quite a bit more disturbing. Such vigils in fact lie within the providence of the psychopomps, a race of immortals charged with the protection and guidance of mortal souls through the afterlife. The Grim Reaper has little interest in protecting souls or guiding them. It is instead compelled by sinister agendas arising within the nighted realm of Abaddon, where the Horsemen of the Apocalypse rule. Indeed there are many similarities in shape and form between the Grim Reaper and Charon, the Horseman of Death, but no recorded instance exists of these two powerful entities working together. Instead, the Grim Reaper serves as something of a manifestation of Abaddon itself, and in this regard is believed by some to be an incarnation of the mysterious First Horseman. When the Grim Reaper comes to a world, it does so not as an angel of mercy, but as a relentless harvester of life. Those who fall to the Grim Reaper were not destined to die as much as they were selected, hunted, and murdered.
Perhaps the most frightening legends surrounding the Grim Reaper concern its nature as a singular entity, for some believe that more than one grim reaper exists in the Great Beyond. These whispers tell of a cabal of at least nine of these creatures that stalk reality, culling the living as inexplicable servants of true entropy. According to the teaching of some death cults, the final goal of the Grim Reaper is to end the entire cycle of life and death and serve as a silent lord of an empty universe.

Dead Man’s Hand
Decks of cards are a traditional method used to tell a person’s fortune, but legends hold that certain cards or combinations of unfortunate draws can attract the attention of the grim reaper. Specialized fortune-telling decks, such as the Harrow, might not feature the visage of the grim reaper directly, but to the paranoid, death could lurk in any unfortunate hand of cards.


Grim Reaper Treasure
The grim reaper keeps no treasure, but sometimes lesser deaths hang on to strange keepsakes from those whom they have slain—especially in cases where a lesser death has set its unholy sight on an extended family or faction.

attribs.name: repeating_interaction-abilities_-NK-ESAb2iUhNrKd41xh_description
attribs.current:
Troops are composed of many individuals, and over the course of enough attacks and downed comrades, troops shrink in size. Most troops start with 16 squares (4 by 4), and their Hit Points have two listed thresholds, typically the first is at 2/3 their maximum Hit Points and the second is at 1/3 their maximum Hit Points. Once the troop drops below the first threshold, it loses 4 squares, leaving 12 squares remaining, and the first threshold becomes the troop’s new maximum Hit Points. Once the troop falls below the second threshold, it loses another 4 squares, leaving 8 squares remaining, and the second threshold becomes the troop’s new maximum Hit Points. In order to restore its size and maximum Hit Points, a troop needs to spend downtime to use long-term treatment on casualties or recruit new members to replace the fallen. At 0 Hit Points, the troop is reduced down to 4 squares, which is too few to sustain the troop, so it disperses entirely, with the few remaining members surrendering, fleeing, or easily dispatched, depending on their nature. 
A damaging single-target effect, such as a Strike, can’t force a troop to pass through more than one threshold at once. For instance, if a troop had 60 Hit Points, with thresholds at 40 and 20, a Strike for 50 damage would leave the troop at 21 Hit Points, just above the second threshold. A damaging area effect or multi-target effect can cross multiple thresholds at once and could potentially destroy the entire troop in one shot. 
Non-damaging effects with an area or that target all creatures in a certain proximity affect a troop normally if they affect the entire area occupied by the troop. If an effect has a smaller area or numbers of targets, it typically has no effect on the troop. However, if the effect can target at least four creatures or cover at least four squares in the troop, and if it would prevent its targets from acting, cause them to flee, or otherwise make them unable to function as part of the troop for a round or more, the troop loses loses a number of Hit Points equal to the amount required to bring it to the next threshold, removing 4 squares. If an effect would both deal damage and automatically cross a threshold due to incapacitating some of the creatures in the troop, apply the damage first. If the damage wasn’t enough to cross a threshold on its own, then reduce the Hit Points to cross the threshold for the incapacitating effect.

{"size":"Medium","Token":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/files.d20.io/images/93311480/3nxdt5iNesmDM0iIGj3QZQ/original.png","level":"17","senses":"hears heartbeats (imprecise) 60 feet, darkvision","traits":"Uncommon, Incorporeal, Spirit, Undead","Category":"Monsters","npc_type":"Creature","Expansion":"4137","alignment":"CE","data-List":"false","languages":"Common, Elven","occultism":"25","acrobatics":"31","immunities":"disease, paralyzed, poison, precision, unconscious","perception":"32","armor_class":"39","description":"Banshees are the furious, tormented souls of elves bound to the Material Plane by a betrayal that defined the final hours of their lives. Some banshees arise from elves who were slain by trusted friends and allies, or whose loved ones betrayed them on their deathbeds. Others spawn from elves whose treacherous deeds shortly before their deaths left a stain upon their souls. Regardless of their origin, banshees despise the living. This hatred of life is all too often a horrific inversion of their personalities in life. Some speculate that the more kind-hearted the elf (and the more wrenching the betrayal), the crueler the banshee.
Banshees rarely stray far from where they perished and typically haunt thick forests and canopied swamps where little light graces the ground. Many banshees can be found in the elven nation of Kyonin, specifically in Tanglebriar, the sinister domain of the demon Treerazer. Similarly, a large number of banshees can be found lurking about the edges of drow settlements in the Darklands, as plenty of cruelty and betrayal exists in drow culture.
Banshees’ mere touch inflicts pain and primal fear, and those exposed to their wails of grief rarely survive the experience. 
Born from Tragedy
The banshee represents one of the most tragic of undead, a soul so wracked with agony and fury over a betrayal in life that, in death, it lingers on as a great evil. attribs.name: repeating_actions-activities_-NK-FqYM4psDYZxJosaX_description
attribs.current: A creature damaged by the banshee’s touch that isn’t already frightened must attempt a DC 38 Will save (DC 43 if the attack was a critical hit). If the creature fails its save, it’s frightened 2; on a critical failure, the creature also cowers with fear and is stunned 4. If the creature is protected against fear by a spell or magic item, the banshee’s touch first attempts to counteract the protection effect, with the effect of a 9th-level dispel magic spell.

attribs.name: repeating_actions-activities_-NK-FqYM4psDYZxJosaY_description
attribs.current:
The banshee unleashes a soul-chilling wail of the banshee (DC 38). This Wail overcomes silence and similar effects of 5th level or lower. The banshee can instead use Wail as a three-action activity to overcome such effects of up to 8th level.
The banshee’s Wail resonates for 1 round, and any creature that comes within the area during that time must attempt a save against the effect. A creature can’t be affected more than once by the same Wail. The banshee can’t Wail again for [[1d4]] (1d4) rounds.

attribs.name: repeating_free-actions-reactions_-NKsBmXNdjjYrqxiGLVZ_description
attribs.current: The worm prophet is subject to the conqueror worm’s Mental Invader effect (page 67).

attribs.name: repeating_actions-activities_-NKsC6gvFF75QfxkdpMR_description
attribs.current: DC 40, attack +32; 9th dispel magic, divine vessel, harm (×7), zealous conviction; 8th (4 slots) discern location, spirit blast, spiritual epidemic, 7th resist energy, spiritual guardian, warp mind; 6th restoration, spellwrack, true seeing; 5th death ward, drop dead, mind probe; 4th charm, dream message, freedom of movement; 3rd locate, neutralize poison, zone of truth; 2nd calm emotions, death knell, enhance victuals; 1st bane, mending, sanctuary; Cantrips (9th) detect magic, divine lance, forbidding ward, light, message

attribs.name: repeating_actions-activities_-NKsCCvDha65Odc-TFj-_description
attribs.current: 2 Focus Points, DC 40; 9th commanding lash, touch of obedience

attribs.name: repeating_actions-activities_-NKsCGTFtUjEOnMOalu1_description
attribs.current: Trigger A target affected by one of the worm prophet’s necromancy spells dies within 60 feet of the worm prophet; Effect The worm prophet harnesses a bit of the departing victim’s soul, and the worm prophet is quickened 1 for 1 minute. They can use this extra action only to Step, Stride, or Sustain a Spell.

attribs.name: repeating_actions-activities_-NKsCKYGBaHLZEqxPUef_description
attribs.current: If a reaction would disrupt the worm prophet’s spellcasting action, the worm prophet attempts a DC 15 flat check. On a success, the action isn’t disrupted.

attribs.name: repeating_cantrip_-NKsCmCZ21eSn8PlclLl_heightened
attribs.current:
Heightened (3rd) A worm prophet learns the school of magic for the highest-level effect within range that the spell detects. If multiple effects are equally strong, the GM determines which the worm prophet learns.
Heightened (4th) As 3rd level, but a worm prophet also pinpoints the source of the highest-level magic. Like for an imprecise sense, the worm prophet doesn't learn the exact location, but can narrow down the source to within a 5-foot cube (or the nearest if larger than that).

attribs.name: repeating_cantrip_-NKsCmCZ21eSn8PlclLl_description
attribs.current:
A worm prophet sends out a pulse that registers the presence of magic. The worm prophet receives no information beyond the presence or absence of magic. The worm prophet can choose to ignore magic they're fully aware of, such as the magic items and ongoing spells of them and their allies.
You detect illusion magic only if that magic's effect has a lower level than the level of your detect magic spell. However, items that have an illusion aura but aren't deceptive in appearance (such as an invisibility potion) typically are detected normally.

attribs.name: repeating_spellfocus_-NKsCnzVEh09LxeA6sHv_target
attribs.current: A Creature the Worm Prophet Dealt Damage to on Their Most Recent Action.

attribs.name: repeating_spellfocus_-NKsCnzVEh09LxeA6sHv_duration
attribs.current: Until the End of the Target's Next Turn

attribs.name: repeating_spellfocus_-NKsCnzVEh09LxeA6sHv_description
attribs.current: With the threat of more pain, a worm prophet compels a creature they've recently harmed. The worm prophet issues a command to the target, with the effects of the spell command.

attribs.name: repeating_spellfocus_-NKsCnzVEh09LxeA6sHv_cast_detail_information
attribs.current: The Worm Prophet's Most Recent Action Dealt Damage to a Target.

attribs.name: repeating_spellfocus_-NKsCpfgts2ZRSb-sR8Y_description
attribs.current: A worm prophet's imperious touch erodes the target's willpower, making it easier to control. The target attempts a Will save.

attribs.name: repeating_spellfocus_-NKsCpfgts2ZRSb-sR8Y_save_failure
attribs.current: The target is stupefied 1 until the end of the worm prophet's next turn.

attribs.name: repeating_spellfocus_-NKsCpfgts2ZRSb-sR8Y_save_success
attribs.current: The target is stupefied 1 until the end of the worm prophet's current turn.

attribs.name: repeating_spellfocus_-NKsCpfgts2ZRSb-sR8Y_save_critical_failure
attribs.current: The target is stupefied 1 for 1 minute.

attribs.name: repeating_cantrip_-NKsCr-40D6YwbD322QQ_description
attribs.current: A worm prophet unleashes a beam of divine energy. Make a ranged spell attack roll against the target's AC. On a hit, the target takes damage of the chosen alignment type equal to 1d4 + the worm prophet's wisdom modifier (double damage on a critical hit). The spell gains the trait of the alignment the worm prophet chose.

attribs.name: repeating_cantrip_-NKsCu5T1aVGcudZ7AqJ_heightened
attribs.current: Heightened (6th) The status bonus increases to +2.

attribs.name: repeating_cantrip_-NKsCu5T1aVGcudZ7AqJ_description
attribs.current: A worm prophet wards an ally against the attacks and hostile spells from the target enemy. The target ally gains a +1 status bonus to Armour Class and saving throws against the target enemy's attacks, spells, and other effects.

attribs.name: repeating_cantrip_-NKsCvlTZocpZ7DxmOH9_target
attribs.current: 1 Object of 1 Bulk or Less, Either Unattended or Possessed by the Worm Prophet or a Willing Ally

attribs.name: repeating_cantrip_-NKsCvlTZocpZ7DxmOH9_duration
attribs.current: Until the Next Time the Worm Prophet Makes Their Daily Preparations

attribs.name: repeating_cantrip_-NKsCvlTZocpZ7DxmOH9_heightened
attribs.current: Heightened (4th) The object sheds bright light in a 60-foot radius (and dim light for the next 60 feet).

attribs.name: repeating_cantrip_-NKsCvlTZocpZ7DxmOH9_description
attribs.current: The object glows, casting bright light in a 20-foot radius (and dim light for the next 20 feet) like a torch. If the worm prophet casts this spell again on a second object, the light spell on the first object ends.

attribs.name: repeating_cantrip_-NKsCxBxRvj9Tyve76z3_heightened
attribs.current: Heightened (3rd) The spell's range increases to 500 feet.

attribs.name: repeating_cantrip_-NKsCxBxRvj9Tyve76z3_description
attribs.current: A worm prophet mouths words quietly, but instead of coming out of their mouth, they're transferred directly to the ears of the target. While others can't hear the worm prophet's words any better than if they normally mouthed them, the target can hear their words as if they were standing next to them. The target can give a brief response as a reaction, or as a free action on their next turn if they wish, but they must be able to see the worm prophet and be within range to do so. If they respond, their response is delivered directly to the worm prophet's ear, just like the original message.

attribs.name: repeating_normalspells_-NKsCyWYbIbJ6RRe6fxM_description
attribs.current: A worm prophet fills the minds of your enemies with doubt. Targets that fail their Will saves take a –1 status penalty to attack rolls as long as they are in the area. Once per turn, starting the turn after the worm prophet casts bane, they can use a single action, which has the concentrate trait, to increase the emanation’s radius by 5 feet and force enemies in the area that weren’t yet affected to attempt another saving throw. Bane can counteract bless.

attribs.name: repeating_normalspells_-NKsCzo2D521DZJ4lWn4_target
attribs.current: Non-Magical Object of Light Bulk or Less

attribs.name: repeating_normalspells_-NKsCzo2D521DZJ4lWn4_heightened
attribs.current:
Heightened (2nd) A worm prophet can target a non-magical object of 1 Bulk or less.
Heightened (3rd) A worm prophetcan target a non-magical object of 2 Bulk or less, or a magical object of 1 Bulk or less.

attribs.name: repeating_normalspells_-NKsCzo2D521DZJ4lWn4_description
attribs.current: A worm prophet repairs the target item. The worm prophet restores 5 Hit Points per spell level to the target, potentially removing the broken condition if this repairs it past the item's Broken Threshold. The worm prophet can't replace lost pieces or repair an object that's been completely destroyed.

attribs.name: repeating_normalspells_-NKsD015JwREE7VDTpwv_description
attribs.current: A worm prophet wards a creature with protective energy that deters enemy attacks. Creatures attempting to attack the target must attempt a Will save each time. If the target uses a hostile action, the spell ends.

attribs.name: repeating_normalspells_-NKsD015JwREE7VDTpwv_save_failure
attribs.current: The creature can't attack the target and wastes the action. It can't attempt further attacks against the target this turn.

attribs.name: repeating_normalspells_-NKsD015JwREE7VDTpwv_save_success
attribs.current: The creature can attempt its attack and any other attacks against the target this turn.

attribs.name: repeating_normalspells_-NKsD015JwREE7VDTpwv_save_critical_failure
attribs.current: The creature wastes the action and can't attempt to attack the target for the rest of sanctuary's duration.

attribs.name: repeating_normalspells_-NKsD1u5hgTTl3V86ZgR_description
attribs.current: A worm prophet forcibly calms creatures in the area, soothing them into a nonviolent state; each creature must attempt a Will save.

attribs.name: repeating_normalspells_-NKsD1u5hgTTl3V86ZgR_save_failure
attribs.current: Any emotion effects that would affect the creature are suppressed and the creature can't use hostile actions. If the target is subject to hostility from any other creature, it ceases to be affected by calm emotions.

attribs.name: repeating_normalspells_-NKsD1u5hgTTl3V86ZgR_save_success
attribs.current: Calming urges impose a -1 status penalty to the creature's attack rolls.

attribs.name: repeating_normalspells_-NKsD1u5hgTTl3V86ZgR_save_critical_failure
attribs.current: As failure, but hostility doesn't end the effect.

attribs.name: repeating_normalspells_-NKsD4PltPY3i6qQ8RWa_target
attribs.current: 1 Living Creature or 1 Willing Undead Creature

attribs.name: repeating_normalspells_-NKsD4PltPY3i6qQ8RWa_heightened
attribs.current: Heightened (+1) The amount of healing or damage increases by 1d8, and the extra healing for the 2-action version increases by 8.

attribs.name: repeating_normalspells_-NKsD4PltPY3i6qQ8RWa_description
attribs.current:
A worm prophet channels negative energy to harm the living or heal the undead. If the target is a living creature, the worm prophet deals 1d8 negative damage to it, and it gets a basic Fortitude save. If the target is a willing undead creature, the worm prophet restores that amount of Hit Points. The number of actions the worm prophet spends when Casting this Spell determines its targets, range, area, and other parameters.
[one-action] (somatic) The spell has a range of touch.
[two-actions] (somatic, verbal) The spell has a range of 30 feet. If the worm prophet's healing an undead creature, increase the Hit Points restored by 8.
[three-actions] (material, somatic, verbal) The worm prophet disperses negative energy in a 30-foot emanation. This targets all living and undead creatures in the area.

attribs.name: repeating_normalspells_-NKsDBQSqoGD3tZBTFNT_description
attribs.current: A worm prophet snuffs the life out of a creature on the brink of death. The target must attempt a Will save. If this kills it, the worm prophet gain 10 temporary HP and a +1 status bonus to attack and damage rolls for 10 minutes.

attribs.name: repeating_normalspells_-NKsDBQSqoGD3tZBTFNT_save_success
attribs.current: The target's dying value increases by 1.

attribs.name: repeating_normalspells_-NKsDD4byeb61jfwWA7l_target
attribs.current: Up to 1 Gallon of Non-Magical Water or Up to 5 Pounds of Food

attribs.name: repeating_normalspells_-NKsDD4byeb61jfwWA7l_heightened
attribs.current: Heightened (+1) The number of gallons of water a worm prophet can target increases by 1, or the number of pounds of food the worm prophet can target increases by 5.

attribs.name: repeating_normalspells_-NKsDD4byeb61jfwWA7l_description
attribs.current:
A worm prophet transforms the target into delicious fare, changing water into wine or another fine beverage or enhancing the food's taste and ingredients to make it a gourmet treat.
Prior to the transformation, the spell attempts to counteract any poisons in the food or water. The food turns back to normal if not consumed before the duration expires, though any poisons that were counteracted are still gone.

attribs.name: repeating_normalspells_-NKsDEgFu5W5tf1BxFFv_target
attribs.current: 1 Specific Object or Type of Object

attribs.name: repeating_normalspells_-NKsDEgFu5W5tf1BxFFv_heightened
attribs.current: Heightened (5th) A worm prophet can target a specific creature or ancestry instead of an object, but they must have met or seen up close the creature or ancestry they want to target.

attribs.name: repeating_normalspells_-NKsDEgFu5W5tf1BxFFv_description
attribs.current: A worm prophet learns the direction to the target (if the worm prophet picked a specific object, such as “my mother's sword”) or the nearest target (if the worm prophet picked a type of object, such as “swords”). If the target is a specific object, the worm prophet must have observed it directly with their own senses. If it's a type of object, the worm prophet still needs to have an accurate mental image of the type of object. If there's lead or running water between the worm prophet and the target, this spell can't locate the object. This means the worm prophet might find a type of object farther away if the nearest one is behind lead or running water.

attribs.name: repeating_normalspells_-NKsDGB5aKdo2RVfDP1U_description
attribs.current: A worm prophet pours healing magic through the target in an attempt to cure one poison afflicting it. Attempt a counteract check against the poison.

attribs.name: repeating_normalspells_-NKsDHtV3WNt1kT8aWX3_description
attribs.current: A worm prophet designates an area in which creatures are compelled to speak only truth. Creatures within or entering the area have difficulty lying. Each potentially affected creature must attempt a Will save when the spell is cast or when the creature first enters the area. It uses the results of this initial save if it leaves and reenters the area. Affected creatures are aware of this enchantment; therefore, they can avoid answering questions to which they would normally respond with a lie, or they can be evasive as long as they remain within the boundaries of the truth.

attribs.name: repeating_normalspells_-NKsDHtV3WNt1kT8aWX3_save_failure
attribs.current: The target can't speak any deliberate and intentional lies, and it takes a –2 status penalty to Deception checks.

attribs.name: repeating_normalspells_-NKsDHtV3WNt1kT8aWX3_save_success
attribs.current: The target takes a –2 status penalty to Deception checks.

attribs.name: repeating_normalspells_-NKsDHtV3WNt1kT8aWX3_save_critical_failure
attribs.current: The target can't speak any deliberate and intentional lies and takes a –4 status penalty to Deception checks.

attribs.name: repeating_normalspells_-NKsDIyXjT5WgK6eGaQh_heightened
attribs.current:
Heightened (4th) The duration lasts until the next time a worm prophet makes their daily preparations.
Heightened (8th) The duration lasts until the next time a worm prophet makes their daily preparations, and they can target up to 10 creatures.

attribs.name: repeating_normalspells_-NKsDIyXjT5WgK6eGaQh_description
attribs.current:
To the target, the worm prophet's words are honey and their visage seems bathed in a dreamy haze. It must attempt a Will save, with a +4 circumstance bonus if the worm prophet or their allies recently threatened it or used hostile actions against it. 
The worm prophet can Dismiss the spell. If the worm prophet uses hostile actions against the target, the spell ends. When the spell ends, the target doesn 't necessarily realize it was charmed unless its friendship with the worm prophet or the actions they convinced it to take clash with its expectations, meaning they could potentially convince the target to continue being their friend via mundane means.

attribs.name: repeating_normalspells_-NKsDIyXjT5WgK6eGaQh_save_failure
attribs.current: The target 's attitude becomes friendly toward the worm prophet. If it was friendly, it becomes helpful. It can 't use hostile actions against the worm prophet.

attribs.name: repeating_normalspells_-NKsDIyXjT5WgK6eGaQh_save_success
attribs.current: The target is unaffected but thinks the worm prophet's spell was something harmless instead of charm, unless it identifies the spell (usually by using Identifying Magic, see Identifying Spells).

attribs.name: repeating_normalspells_-NKsDIyXjT5WgK6eGaQh_save_critical_failure
attribs.current: The target 's attitude becomes helpful toward the worm prophet, and it can 't use hostile actions against them.

attribs.name: repeating_normalspells_-NKsDIyXjT5WgK6eGaQh_save_critical_success
attribs.current: The target is unaffected and aware the worm prophet tried to charm it.

attribs.name: repeating_normalspells_-NKsDJxcN0Ur5jp514YE_target
attribs.current: 10 Creatures the Worm Prophet Knows by Name and Have Met in Person

attribs.name: repeating_normalspells_-NKsDJxcN0Ur5jp514YE_description
attribs.current: A worm prophet sends a message to their target's dream. The message is one-way, up to 1 minute of speech (roughly 150 words). If the target is asleep, they receive the message instantly. If not, they receive it the next time they sleep. As soon as they receive it, the spell ends, and the worm prophet knows the message was sent.

attribs.name: repeating_normalspells_-NKsDJxcN0Ur5jp514YE_heightened
attribs.current: Heightened (4th) A worm prophet can target up to 10 creatures they know by name and have met in person. The worm prophet must send the same message to all of them; the spell ends for each creature individually.

attribs.name: repeating_normalspells_-NKsDLZQFy-gk3bWVrnd_description
attribs.current: A worm prophet repels effects that would hinder a creature or slow its movement. While under this spell's effect, the target ignores effects that would give them a circumstance penalty to Speed. When they attempt to Escape an effect that has them immobilized, grabbed, or restrained, they automatically succeed unless the effect is magical and of a higher level than the freedom of movement spell.

attribs.name: repeating_normalspells_-NKsDOqQ0HYhJr3iZ71Z_description
attribs.current: A worm prophet shields a creature from the ravages of negative energy. It receives a +4 status bonus to saves against death and negative effects, gains negative resistance 10, and suppresses the effects of the doomed condition.

attribs.name: repeating_normalspells_-NKsDQ4RxMuHkCIsVhYx_heightened
attribs.current: Heightened (7th) The spell doesn't end if the target uses hostile actions.

attribs.name: repeating_normalspells_-NKsDQ4RxMuHkCIsVhYx_description
attribs.current: The target appears to fall down dead, though it actually turns invisible. Its illusory corpse remains where it fell, complete with a believable fatal wound. This illusion looks and feels like a dead body. If the target's death seems absurd—for instance, a barbarian at full health appears to be slain by 2 damage—the GM can grant the attacker an immediate Perception check to disbelieve the illusion. If the target uses hostile actions, the spell ends. This ends the entire spell, so the illusory corpse disappears too.

attribs.name: repeating_normalspells_-NKsDQ4RxMuHkCIsVhYx_cast_detail_information
attribs.current: A Creature within Range Is Hit by an Attack from an Enemy.

attribs.name: repeating_normalspells_-NKsDR7hDZzYdH-FJE-E_description
attribs.current: A worm prophet casts their thoughts through a creature's mind, sifting for information. The worm prophet accesses the target's memories and knowledge unless it fends them off with a Will save.

attribs.name: repeating_normalspells_-NKsDR7hDZzYdH-FJE-E_save_failure
attribs.current: Each round of the spell's duration, the worm prophet can Sustain the Spell to ask a different question and attempt to uncover the answer. For each question, the target can attempt a Deception check against the worm prophet's spell DC; if the target succeeds, the worm prophet doesn't learn the answer, and on a critical success, the target gives the worm prophet a false answer that they believe is truthful Once the worm prophet's asked the target a given question, asking it again, even with a separate casting of mind probe, produces the same result.

attribs.name: repeating_normalspells_-NKsDR7hDZzYdH-FJE-E_save_critical_failure
attribs.current: As failure, and the target takes a –4 circumstance penalty to Deception checks against the worm prophet's questions.

attribs.name: repeating_normalspells_-NKsDT6kyraIV8-dvxYW_heightened
attribs.current:
Heightened (4th) Add drained to the list of conditions a worm prophet can reduce. When the worm prophet lessens a toxin, reduce the stage by two. The worm prophet also gains a third option that allows them to reduce the target's doomed value by 1. The worm prophet can't use this to reduce a permanent doomed condition.
Heightened (6th) As the 4th-level restoration, but a worm prophet can reduce a permanent doomed condition if they add a spellcasting action and a material component while Casting the Spell, during which you provide 100 gp worth of diamond dust as a cost.

attribs.name: repeating_normalspells_-NKsDT6kyraIV8-dvxYW_description
attribs.current:
Restorative magic counters the effects of toxins or conditions that prevent a creature from functioning at its best. When a worm prophet casts restoration, choose to either reduce a condition or lessen the effect of a toxin. A creature can benefit from only one restoration spell each day, and it can't benefit from restoration more than once to reduce the stage of the same exposure to a given toxin.
• Reduce a Condition Reduce the value of the target's clumsy, enfeebled, or stupefied condition by 2. The worm prophet can instead reduce two of the listed conditions by 1 each.
• Lessen a Toxin Reduce the stage of one toxin the target suffers from by one stage. This can't reduce the stage below stage 1 or cure the affliction.

attribs.name: repeating_normalspells_-NKsDV5ZllQWwMfUoNkw_description
attribs.current: A worm prophet causes any spells cast on the target to spill out their energy in harmful surges. The target must attempt a Will save.

attribs.name: repeating_normalspells_-NKsDV5ZllQWwMfUoNkw_save_failure
attribs.current: As success, but the curse and persistent damage do not end on their own.

attribs.name: repeating_normalspells_-NKsDV5ZllQWwMfUoNkw_save_success
attribs.current: Whenever the target becomes affected by a spell with a duration, the target takes 2d12 persistent force damage. Each time it takes persistent force damage from spellwrack, it reduces the remaining duration of spells affecting it by 1 round. Only a successful Arcana check against the worm prophet's spell DC can help the target recover from the persistent damage; the curse and the persistent damage end after 1 minute.

attribs.name: repeating_normalspells_-NKsDV5ZllQWwMfUoNkw_save_critical_failure
attribs.current: As failure, but the persistent force damage is 4d12.

attribs.name: repeating_normalspells_-NKsDWJnlZ0rvKUWvKgy_description
attribs.current: A worm prophet sees things within 60 feet as they actually are. The GM rolls a secret counteract check against any illusion or transmutation in the area, but only for the purpose of determining whether the worm prophet sees through it (for instance, if the check succeeds against a polymorph spell, the worm prophet can see the creature's true form, but they don't end the polymorph spell).

attribs.name: repeating_normalspells_-NKsDY7qq3JGTh9avOkS_heightened
attribs.current:
Heightened (4th) The resistance increases to 10, and a worm prophet can target up to two creatures.
Heightened (7th) The resistance increases to 15, and a worm prophet can target up to five creatures.

attribs.name: repeating_normalspells_-NKsDY7qq3JGTh9avOkS_description
attribs.current: A shield of elemental energy protects a creature against one type of energy damage. Choose acid, cold, electricity, fire, or sonic damage. The target and its gear gain resistance 5 against the damage type a worm prophet chose.

attribs.name: repeating_normalspells_-NKsDZj35BcDPVG3M1yB_heightened
attribs.current: Heightened (+2) The guardian's damage increases by 1d8, and its Hit Points increase by 20.

attribs.name: repeating_normalspells_-NKsDZj35BcDPVG3M1yB_description
attribs.current:
A Medium guardian made of magical force appears and attacks foes a worm prophet designates within range. The spiritual guardian is translucent and appears to be holding a dagger.
When the worm prophet Cast the Spell, the spiritual guardian appears in an unoccupied space next to a foe of their choice within range and makes a Strike against it. Each time the worm prophet Sustain the Spell, they can move the spiritual guardian to an unoccupied space next to a target within range (if necessary) and make a Strike with it. The guardian uses and contributes to the worm prophet's multiple attack penalty. Alternatively, when the worm prophet Sustain the Spell, they can have the guardian move adjacent to an ally and protect that ally. If the worm prophet does, each time the ally would take damage, the guardian takes the first 10 damage instead of their ally. It continues to do so until the worm prophet moves the guardian to attack an enemy or defend a different ally, or until the guardian is destroyed (it has 50 Hit Points and can't recover Hit Points by any means). The guardian can't usually take damage except when protecting an ally, though disintegrate automatically destroys it if it hits the spiritual guardian's AC of 25. 
The guardian's Strikes are melee spell attacks. Regardless of the appearance of the guardian's weapon, the guardian deals force damage equal to 2d8 plus the worm prophet's wisdom modifier, but they can deal damage of the type normally dealt by the weapon it holds instead of force damage. No other traits or statistics of the weapon apply, and even a ranged weapon attacks adjacent creatures only. Despite making a spell attack, the spiritual guardian's weapon is a weapon for the purposes of triggers, resistances, and so forth.
The guardian takes up space and allies can use it when flanking, but it doesn't have any other attributes a creature would normally have aside from Hit Points, and creatures can move through its space without hindrance. The guardian can't make any attack other than its Strike, and feats or spells that affect weapons or enhance allies do not apply to the guardian.

attribs.name: repeating_normalspells_-NKsDZj35BcDPVG3M1yB_cast_detail_information
attribs.current: A Worm Prophet Has a Deity.

attribs.name: repeating_normalspells_-NKsDaAtq2xSKJUz0qbv_description
attribs.current: A worm prophet scrambles a creature's mental faculties and sensory input. The target must attempt a Will saving throw. Regardless of the result of that save, the target is then temporarily immune for 10 minutes. Warp mind's effects happen instantly, so dispel magic and other effects that counteract spells can't counteract them. However, alter reality, miracle, primal phenomenon, restoration, or wish can still counteract the effects.

attribs.name: repeating_normalspells_-NKsDaAtq2xSKJUz0qbv_save_failure
attribs.current: The target is confused for 1 minute.

attribs.name: repeating_normalspells_-NKsDaAtq2xSKJUz0qbv_save_success
attribs.current: The target spends the first action on its next turn with the confused condition.

attribs.name: repeating_normalspells_-NKsDcduN36WsbEP2vXZ_description
attribs.current:
A worm prophet learns the name of the target's exact location (including the building, community, and country) and plane of existence.
The worm prophet can target a creature only if they've seen it in person, have one of its significant belongings, or have a piece of its body. To target an object, the worm prophet must have touched it or have a fragment of it. Discern location automatically overcomes protections against detection and divination of lower level than this spell, even if they would normally have a chance to block it.

attribs.name: repeating_normalspells_-NKsDekFO0s7BRjQsJUz_description
attribs.current: A worm prophet concentrates ethereal energy and attack a creature's spirit, dealing 16d6 force damage. Because spirit blast affects the creature's spirit, it can damage a target projecting its consciousness (such as via project image) or possessing another creature even if the target's body is elsewhere. The possessed creature isn't harmed by the blast. The blast doesn't harm creatures that have no spirit, such as constructs.

attribs.name: repeating_normalspells_-NKsDgnmNF96ekxUw45K_description
attribs.current: A worm prophet curses the target, sapping its spirit and leaving a contagious trap in its essence. The target must attempt a Will save. Any creature that casts a divine or occult spell on the target while it's affected is targeted by spiritual epidemic and must also attempt a Will save. The curse continues to spread in this way.

attribs.name: repeating_normalspells_-NKsDgnmNF96ekxUw45K_save_failure
attribs.current: The target is enfeebled 2 and stupefied 2 for 1 minute and enfeebled 1 and stupefied 1 permanently.

attribs.name: repeating_normalspells_-NKsDgnmNF96ekxUw45K_save_success
attribs.current: The target is enfeebled 2 and stupefied 2 for 1 round.

attribs.name: repeating_normalspells_-NKsDgnmNF96ekxUw45K_save_critical_failure
attribs.current: The target is enfeebled 3 and stupefied 3 for 1 minute and enfeebled 2 and stupefied 2 permanently.

attribs.name: repeating_normalspells_-NKsDiFoRLD9ctcjBdC4_target
attribs.current: 1 Spell Effect or Unattended Magic Item

attribs.name: repeating_normalspells_-NKsDiFoRLD9ctcjBdC4_description
attribs.current: A worm prophet unravels the magic behind a spell or effect. Attempt a counteract check against the target. Counteracting a Magic Item causes it to become mundane for 10 minutes. This doesn't change the item's non-magical properties. If the target is an artifact or similar item, the worm prophet automatically fails.

attribs.name: repeating_normalspells_-NKsDje4QKcmRi5XQi8J_heightened
attribs.current: Heightened (9th) The temporary Hit Points increase to 60, the weakness increases to 15, and the duration increases to 10 minutes.

attribs.name: repeating_normalspells_-NKsDje4QKcmRi5XQi8J_description
attribs.current:
A worm prophet accepts otherworldly energies into their body; while they are still recognizably themself, they gain the features of one of the conqueror worm's servitors. This spell gains the trait of the alignment the worm prophet chose.
If the worm prophet was Medium or smaller, they become Large, as the effects of enlarge. The worm prophet must have space to expand into, or the spell is lost. The worm prophet also gains the following benefits.
• 40 temporary Hit Points.
• A fly Speed equal to the worm prophet's Speed.
• Weakness 10 to the alignment opposite the one the worm prophet chose.
• A +1 status bonus to saves against spells.
• Darkvision.
• The worm prophet unarmed attacks and weapons deal 1 additional damage of the chosen alignment type.
• One or more unarmed melee attacks. If the worm prophet chose evil, they gain a claws unarmed attack that deals 2d8 slashing damage and has the agile and finesse traits.

attribs.name: repeating_normalspells_-NKsDl-F1KNcZczxIvJQ_heightened
attribs.current: Heightened (9th) The temporary Hit Points increase to 18, and the status bonus to Will saves increases to +3.

attribs.name: repeating_normalspells_-NKsDl-F1KNcZczxIvJQ_description
attribs.current: A worm prophet bypasses their targets' rational minds, instilling them with unshakable conviction and zeal. The targets each gain 12 temporary Hit Points and a +2 status bonus to Will saves against mental effects, as their faith overrides the signals from their own bodies and minds. If the worm prophet tells a target to do something, it must comply with their request, though if it would normally find the task repugnant, it can attempt a Will save at the end of its turn each round due to the cognitive dissonance. On a success, it ends the spell's effects on itself entirely.

attribs.name: repeating_free-actions-reactions_-NKsBj-Rit75p0M5lwGj_description
attribs.current: The worm prophet has a +2 circumstance bonus to Deception checks and saving throws to conceal their identity and a +2 circumstance bonus to their Deception DC against effects that ferret out information about the worm prophet’s identity.

attribs.name: repeating_free-actions-reactions_-NKsBrcVLNqRp3P6ZoZT_trigger
attribs.current: The worm prophet rolls a failure (but not a critical failure) on a Will save against an effect with the mental or fear trait;

attribs.name: repeating_free-actions-reactions_-NKsBrcVLNqRp3P6ZoZT_description
attribs.current: Requirements The worm prophet’s features are obscured by a mask or hood; Effect The worm prophet takes [[3d8]] (3d8) mental damage, and the saving throw is a success.

attribs.name: repeating_free-actions-reactions_-NKsEH9eDMa3XjXdjqAu_trigger
attribs.current: A creature disturbs any of the platforms, or anything falls into the pit;

attribs.name: repeating_free-actions-reactions_-NKsEH9eDMa3XjXdjqAu_description
attribs.current: Effect The room rotates 45 degrees, closing off the room by shifting its exits to face bare walls. A pendulum of force swings across the platform with the armor on it, knocking the armour into the pit and making a pendulum blade Strike against a creature on that platform (if any). The trap then rolls for initiative.

attribs.name: repeating_free-actions-reactions_-NKsEUhluNmwL1EPrKtO_description
attribs.current: For each active platform, the trap uses an action to create a pendulum of force to swing down along a straight line between the platform and one other creature in the room that isn’t on the platform (if any). The trap makes a pendulum blade attack against any creature in that line. For each platform deactivated, reduce the number of actions the trap takes in its routine by 1.

attribs.name: repeating_melee-strikes_-NK-GkYu4rw1zUZd33M4_weapon_notes
attribs.current: plus Pendulum Shove; No Multiple Attack Penalty

attribs.name: repeating_actions-activities_-NKsEk-F7jBULCq6-Day_description
attribs.current: A creature hit by a pendulum blade must succeed at a DC 44 Reflex save or be moved 5 feet along the line of the pendulum’s swing. This is forced movement.

attribs.name: repeating_actions-activities_-NKsEnQNURSH31J8D54f_description
attribs.current: The trap resets after 1 hour. If the darkness throughout the room has been dispelled, the darkness in the room returns when the trap resets.

attribs.current:
{"size":"Huge","Token":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/files.d20.io/images/206699205/KKMa38wYdpRh2qu2IQLctg/original.png","level":"20","speed":"45","arcana":"33","senses":"darkvision, true seeing","traits":"Fiend, Sahkil","stealth":"36","Category":"Monsters","npc_type":"Creature","religion":"35","spell_dc":"42","Expansion":"9361","alignment":"NE","athletics":"38","data-List":"false","deception":"38","languages":"Abyssal, Celestial, Infernal, Requian; telepathy 100 feet, tongues","occultism":"33","acrobatics":"36","immunities":"death effects, fear","perception":"35","weaknesses":"good 20","armor_class":"45","description":"Sahkil
Ages ago, when this cycle of the multiverse was still adolescent, a cabal of psychopomps who already felt bored and restrained in their role of ushering souls to their ultimate resting place rebelled against their station. It was this corruption of the cycle of souls that spawned the first sahkils. 
Ambivalent to the prescribed order of the multiverse and spiteful of mortals, sahkils delight in spreading fear and unease to all beings, clogging up the metaphysical cycle with anxiety-ridden mortals too scared to achieve their potential. These fiends have drastically changed from their dedicated psychopomp predecessors. They are creatures of spite and torment, fear and disgust. They exploit the most common and rare fears for their own perverse satisfaction, and they want nothing more than to frighten mortals and make them question their reason for existence.
Most sahkils lurk on the Ethereal Plane, but they frequently invade the Material Plane to torment mortals and spread terror. They use their innate ability to slip between the veils of the Ethereal and Material effortlessly, often stalking their targets for days or weeks before enacting their devious plots.
Check with Friends
Sahkils are creatures of fear and terror. Roleplaying encounters with sahkils could be troubling to some players, and delving deep into the kinds of traumas sahkils relish in unleashing could have unintentional effects on your game and your friends. Before introducing sahkils into your game, talk with your players to learn about any particular phobias or limits to determine what content you bring to the table, and consider that on your own behalf as well. Some specific elements to be aware of are the ximtal’s abilities around sensory deprivation and social isolation, as well as the kimenhul’s trauma-related abilities and themes. 
Feeding on Fear
Sahkils are immortal planar beings and don’t require material sustenance, but they do seem to gain some semblance of nourishment from the fear they spread. Whether this is psychological or biological remains to be seen, but their obsession with frightening other creatures is clear. Sahkils recognize that they are already feared, so it may be that they are simply fulfilling what they believe is their ultimate purpose.
War Against Hope
Sahkils and couatls are eternal enemies. The creatures each vie for the hearts of mortals, but from different sides of a single ideological coin. Sahkils wish to instill only fear into mortal hearts, trying to reduce them into useless piles of flesh who accomplish little. Couatls work to light the fires of hope, inspiring mortals to rise up and achieve their potential.
Planar Relations
Sahkils collaborate with divs to corrupt and corrode mortals. Velstracs, who appreciate sahkils’ depredations, sometimes work with these fiends to enact terrible horror on their victims. Nihilistic and disaffected, daemons tolerate sahkils but tend to view them as useless provocateurs.
Sahkil Tormentors
The most powerful among sahkils are the sahkil tormentors. These deific beings rule over sahkils as a whole, and many personally direct the actions of their lesser cousins. Others fall into ambivalent routines, focusing more on their own personal acts of torment rather than launching widespread, ambitious depredations upon unsuspecting mortals.
Xibalba
Within the ghostly realm of the Ethereal Plane, sahkils inhabit a terrifying realm known as Xibalba. The Land of Dread is a realm of nightmares made manifest. At the center of this demiplane is a tiered pyramid known as the Black Pyramid, where the sahkil tormentors rule their brethren and sow fear through the mortal realm.
Kimenhul
Among the strongest of their kind aside from the sahkil tormentors, kimenhuls work their craft to foment despair in those who fear failure, forming cycles of self-loathing. These powerful sahkils focus their attention on mortals who are seemingly at the peak of their ability yet harbor secret fears of inadequacy. A kimenhul’s predations can leave an indelible mark on its victims. The kimenhul whispers threats and sends fears of crushing failure to its prey, seemingly originating from their own minds, a trauma that can be difficult to bear without help. These sahkils torment their prey as long as the hapless victims live, using their Eternal Fear ability every day to psychically remind their previous victims of their failings.
Some unique kimenhuls find themselves in a position of leadership in Xibalba, where they carve out their own small kingdoms and direct groups of sahkils to help them find mortals to torment. They rule these nightmare kingdoms through terror, often delighting in tormenting new petitioners or scheming ways to work against their immortal foes.","speed_notes":"climb 25 attribs.name: repeating_interaction-abilities_-NK-dMWh67o2SfXMZfa-_description
attribs.current: The Three-Faced Regent regains 30 Hit Points at the start of its turn as long as any frightened creature is within 100 feet of it.

attribs.name: repeating_free-actions-reactions_-NK-dMWh67o2SfXMZfa0_trigger
attribs.current: A creature within the Three-Faced Regent’s reach uses a manipulate action or a move action, makes a ranged attack, or leaves a square during a move action it’s using.

attribs.name: repeating_free-actions-reactions_-NK-dMWh67o2SfXMZfa0_description
attribs.current: If the triggering creature is subject to an effect with the fear trait, the Three-Faced Regent can make two claw Strikes against the creature instead of one Strike. Effect: The Three-Faced Regent attempts a melee Strike against the triggering creature. If the attack is a critical hit and the trigger was a manipulate action, the monster disrupts that action. This Strike doesn’t count toward the Three-Faced Regent’s multiple attack penalty, and its multiple attack penalty doesn’t apply to this Strike.

attribs.name: repeating_actions-activities_-NK-dMWi6dBDC09Hv1cP_rep_traits
attribs.current: Divine, Emotion, Enchantment, Fear, Incapacitation, Mental

attribs.name: repeating_actions-activities_-NK-dMWi6dBDC09Hv1cP_description
attribs.current:
The Three-Faced Regent contorts its faces and presents itself to its enemies in a terrifying and traumatic display that causes lingering fear. Each creature within 100 feet that can observe the Three-Faced Regent must make a DC 42 Will save. They are then temporarily immune for 10 minutes. 
Critical Success: The target is unaffected.
Success: The target becomes frightened 3. 
Failure: The target becomes frightened 3 and is fleeing as long as it’s frightened. Even after recovering from the initial experience, the trauma is lodged in the target’s mind for 1 year. Once per day, the Three-Faced Regent can communicate telepathically with the target for 1 minute as long as both creatures are on the same plane. Any time a creature under the effect of Eternal Fear is in a stressful situation (such as combat or intense social pressure), they must succeed at a DC 11 flat check or become frightened 2. While Eternal Fear lasts, the target always becomes fleeing as long as it’s frightened, regardless of the source of the fear. The target can attempt a new saving throw each week to remove these effects, but they can otherwise be removed only by powerful magic such as wish.
Critical Failure: As failure, but the effects are permanent and the target doesn’t get to attempt a weekly save to end the effect.

attribs.name: repeating_actions-activities_-NK-dMWi6dBDC09Hv1cQ_description
attribs.current: The Three-Faced Regent makes one jaws Strike and two claw Strikes against a single target, in any order. The target becomes frightened with a condition value equal to the number of Strikes that hit it, to a maximum of frightened 3 if all three Strikes hit.

attribs.name: repeating_actions-activities_-NK-dMWi6dBDC09Hv1cR_description
repeating_actions-activities_-NK-dMWi6dBDC09Hv1cS_description
attribs.current: The Three-Faced Regent moves from the Material Plane to the Ethereal Plane or vice-versa, with the effects of ethereal jaunt except that the effect has an unlimited duration and can be Dismissed.

attribs.name: repeating_actions-activities_-NK-dMWi6dBDC09Hv1cT_description
attribs.current: When using Skip Between, the Three-Faced Regent can bring along any creatures it has grabbed.

attribs.name: repeating_actions-activities_-NK-dMWi6dBDC09Hv1cU_description
attribs.current: Any creature affected by any of a Three-Faced Regent’s mental spells or abilities becomes stupefied 3 for the duration of that effect and for [[1d4]] (1d4) rounds thereafter.

attribs.name: repeating_actions-activities_-NK-dMWi6dBDC09Hv1cV_description
attribs.current: DC 42; 9th confusion, dispel magic (at will), fear (at will), mask of terror (at will), phantasmal calamity, suggestion (at will), warp mind, weird; Cantrips (10th) detect magic; Constant (9th) mind blank, true seeing

attribs.name: repeating_spellinnate_-NK-dMWi6dBDC09Hv1cW_description
attribs.current: The Three-Faced Regent befuddles its target with strange impulses, causing it to act randomly. The effects are determined by the target's Will save. The Three-Faced Regent can Dismiss the spell.

attribs.name: repeating_spellinnate_-NK-dMWi6dBDC09Hv1cX_description
attribs.current: The Three-Faced Regent unravels the magic behind a spell or effect. Attempt a counteract check against the target. Counteracting a Magic Item causes it to become mundane for 10 minutes. This doesn't change the item's non-magical properties. If the target is an artefact or similar item, the Three-Faced Regent automatically fails.

attribs.name: repeating_spellinnate_-NK-dMWjnNUei4zrc4gB_description
attribs.current: The Three-Faced Regent plants fear in the target; it must attempt a Will save.

attribs.name: repeating_spellinnate_-NK-dMWjnNUei4zrc4gC_description
attribs.current:
The target appears to be a gruesome and terrifying creature. The effect is unique to each observer, so a human viewing the target might see a demon with bloody fangs, but a demon observing the target might see a glowing angelic visage.
When any creature attempts a hostile action against the target, the creature must attempt a Will save. It is then temporarily immune until the end of its next turn.

attribs.name: repeating_spellinnate_-NK-dMWjnNUei4zrc4gD_description
attribs.current: A vision of apocalyptic destruction fills the mind of each creature in the area. The vision deals 11d6 mental damage (basic Will save). On a critical failure, the creature must also succeed at a Reflex save or believe it's trapped (stuck in a fissure, adrift at sea, or some other fate in keeping with its vision). If it fails the second save, it's also stunned for 1 minute. It can attempt a new Will save at the end of each of its turns, and on a success, it disbelieves the illusion and recovers from the stunned condition.

attribs.name: repeating_spellinnate_-NK-dMWjnNUei4zrc4gE_description
attribs.current: The Three-Faced Regent's honeyed words are difficult for creatures to resist. The Three-Faced Regent suggests a course of action to the target, which must be phrased in such a way as to seem like a logical course of action to the target and can't be self‑destructive or obviously against the target's self-interest. The target must attempt a Will save.

attribs.name: repeating_spellinnate_-NK-dMWjnNUei4zrc4gF_description
attribs.current: The Three-Faced Regent scrambles a creature's mental faculties and sensory input. The target must attempt a Will saving throw. Regardless of the result of that save, the target is then temporarily immune for 10 minutes. Warp mind's effects happen instantly, so dispel magic and other effects that counteract spells can't counteract them. However, alter reality, miracle, primal phenomenon, restoration, or wish can still counteract the effects.

attribs.name: repeating_spellinnate_-NK-dMWjnNUei4zrc4gG_description
attribs.current: The Three-Faced Regent fill the targets' minds with terrifying images of fearsome creatures, each drawn from the targets' worst fears. Only the targets can see their assailants. Each target takes 16d6 mental damage and must attempt a Will save.

attribs.name: repeating_spellinnate_-NK-dMWjnNUei4zrc4gH_description
attribs.current: Powerful wards hide a creature from divination magic. The target gains a +4 status bonus to saves against mental effects. Mind blank attempts to counteract any detection, revelation, and scrying effects as if its spell level were 1 higher than its actual level. On a success, the divination effect functions normally except that it detects nothing about the target and its possessions. For instance, detect magic would still detect other magic in the area, but not any magic on the target.

attribs.name: repeating_spellinnate_-NK-dMWjnNUei4zrc4gI_description
attribs.current: The Three-Faced Regent sees things within 60 feet as they actually are. The GM rolls a secret counteract check against any illusion or transmutation in the area, but only for the purpose of determining whether the Three-Faced Regent sees through it (for instance, if the check succeeds against a polymorph spell, the Three-Faced Regent can see the creature's true form, but you don't end the polymorph spell).

attribs.name: repeating_spellinnate_-NK-dMWi6dBDC09Hv1cW_heightened
attribs.current: Heightened (8th) The Three-Faced Regent can target up to 10 creatures.

attribs.name: repeating_spellinnate_-NK-dMWi6dBDC09Hv1cW_save_failure
attribs.current: The target is confused for 1 minute. It can attempt a new save at the end of each of its turns to end the confusion.

attribs.name: repeating_spellinnate_-NK-dMWi6dBDC09Hv1cW_save_success
attribs.current: The target babbles incoherently and is stunned 1.

attribs.name: repeating_spellinnate_-NK-dMWi6dBDC09Hv1cW_save_critical_failure
attribs.current: The target is confused for 1 minute, with no save to end early.

attribs.name: repeating_spellinnate_-NK-dMWi6dBDC09Hv1cX_target
attribs.current: 1 Spell Effect or Unattended Magic Item

attribs.name: repeating_spellinnate_-NK-dMWjnNUei4zrc4gB_heightened
attribs.current: Heightened (3rd) The Three-Faced Regent can target up to five creatures.

attribs.name: repeating_spellinnate_-NK-dMWjnNUei4zrc4gB_save_critical_failure
attribs.current: The target is frightened 3 and fleeing for 1 round.

attribs.name: repeating_spellinnate_-NK-dMWjnNUei4zrc4gC_heightened
attribs.current: Heightened (8th) The Three-Faced Regent can target up to 5 creatures. If a creature uses a hostile action or reaction that affects multiple targets simultaneously, it needs to attempt only one save against mask of terror.

attribs.name: repeating_spellinnate_-NK-dMWjnNUei4zrc4gC_save_failure
attribs.current: The creature becomes frightened 2 before using its action.

attribs.name: repeating_spellinnate_-NK-dMWjnNUei4zrc4gC_save_critical_failure
attribs.current: The creature becomes frightened 2, and its action fails and is wasted.

attribs.name: repeating_spellinnate_-NK-dMWjnNUei4zrc4gE_heightened
attribs.current: Heightened (8th) The Three-Faced Regent can target up to 10 creatures.

attribs.name: repeating_spellinnate_-NK-dMWjnNUei4zrc4gE_save_failure
attribs.current: The target immediately follows the Three-Faced Regent's suggestion. The spell has a duration of 1 minute, or until the target has completed a finite suggestion or the suggestion becomes self-destructive or has other obvious negative effects.

attribs.name: repeating_spellinnate_-NK-dMWjnNUei4zrc4gE_save_success
attribs.current: The target is unaffected and thinks the Three-Faced Regent was talking to them normally, not casting a spell on them.

attribs.name: repeating_spellinnate_-NK-dMWjnNUei4zrc4gG_save_critical_failure
attribs.current: The target is so afraid, it might instantly die. It must attempt a Fortitude saving throw. If the target succeeds, it takes double damage and is frightened 2, and it's also fleeing until the end of its next turn unless it critically succeeded. If it fails, it is reduced to 0 Hit Points and dies.

attribs.name: repeating_spellinnate_-NL76qbj6bN0-y-tO8dU_heightened
attribs.current:
Heightened (3rd) The Three-Faced Regent learns the school of magic for the highest-level effect within range that the spell detects. If multiple effects are equally strong, the GM determines which the Three-Faced Regent learns.
Heightened (4th) As 3rd level, but the Three-Faced Regent also pinpoints the source of the highest-level magic. Like for an imprecise sense, the Three-Faced Regent doesn't learn the exact location, but can narrow down the source to within a 5-foot cube (or the nearest if larger than that).

attribs.name: repeating_spellinnate_-NL76qbj6bN0-y-tO8dU_description
attribs.current:
The Three-Faced Regent sends out a pulse that registers the presence of magic. The Three-Faced Regent receives no information beyond the presence or absence of magic. The Three-Faced Regent can choose to ignore magic it's fully aware of, such as the magic items and ongoing spells of it and its allies.
The Three-Faced Regent detect illusion magic only if that magic's effect has a lower level than the level of its detect magic spell. However, items that have an illusion aura but aren't deceptive in appearance (such as an invisibility potion) typically are detected normally.
